title: Tender Writer
description_html:
Monadelphous Mining and Minerals North West team are looking for a new Tender Writer to join our established Tendering and Estimating team. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to develop their career by working alongside our specialised operations team and clients whilst gaining valuable industry experience. Duties include upkeeping bidding and tendering information documentation, collaboratively working with our unit and project managers and meeting deadlines to provide tendering proposals to our clients. This role is a Full Time Permanent Opportunity, working Monday to Friday in our Victoria Park head office.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Front end exposure to the bidding process as we grow our client base and work profile
  • Ongoing training and development opportunities to ensure you can reach your full potential
  • Full time employment with plenty of company benefits

Key Responsibilities:

  • Organising bidding and tendering information into proposal reports and correspondence
  • Effectively assisting the team to deliver to our clients in a timely manner
  • Manage the tendering folder and inbox
  • Analysing data from both internal and external stakeholders to provide information and advice on both ends
  • Complete weekly and monthly reports on tender status and EOI's
  • Meeting deadlines for tender deliverables

What you’ll bring:

  • Previous experience in tendering, bidding and proposal is essential
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in Business Administration is preferred
  • Advanced computer skills across Microsoft suite
  • Ability to establish strong professional relationships with both internal and external stakeholders
  • Strong Attention to Detail and sound Written Communication skills

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the North West communities for over 30 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in heavy lift, maintenance and industrial services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Boilermaker / Welder
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking experienced and local Boilermakers/Welders to join our team in Gladstone. We offer a great opportunity to work with a leading company in the resources, energy, and infrastructure sectors with a focus on providing diverse career opportunities and a strong team culture.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Immediate start available - Start your new role without delay.
  • Maintenance and project work available, providing variety in your day-to-day tasks.
  • Different rosters available / flexibility to suit your lifestyle.
  • Attractive rates - Competitive pay and benefits.
  • Permanent positions - Stability and security for your career 
  • Opportunity for overtime - Earn more with additional hours.
  • Home every night - Live locally and enjoy a better work-life balance

What you will bring:

  • Australian Recognised Trade Certificate (Boilermaker)
  • Current High Risk Work License (preference for WP, LF)
  • Working at Heights training (within 2 years)
  • Confined Space Entry training (within 2 years)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Local to the Gladstone Region
Life at Monadelphous 

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply. We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application. 

About us

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the Gladstone community for over 40 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources, Mineral processing, and Energy sector.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

Recruitment Contacts:

Brisbane Recruitment: 07 3368 6077

title: Monadelphous NDT Technicians
description_html:
We are currently seeking experienced NDT Technicians to join our team. Successful candidates will provide project support across our sites in the Gladstone Region. Permanent positions are available with overtime opportunities.

The Benefits

We provide the benefits you'd expect from a leading Australian company, but what makes us different?

  • Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work on some of the world's biggest resources, energy and infrastructure projects.
  • Our culture. We're solution focused, reliable and embrace a 'can-do' team environment.
  • Our loyalty. We want you to reach your potential, we'd like to help you get there.


What you will bring

  • NDT Qualifications - MT/UTT as a minimum.
  • IRATA Certification - Level 1-3 (Not essential but preferred)
  • High Risk Work Licence (Preference for WP, RB, LF)
  • Working at Heights Training (within 2 years)
  • Confined Space Entry Training (within 2 years)
  • First Aid certificate with current CPR (preferred)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Valid Australian Driver’s Licence
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance.

 

We have been part of the Gladstone community for over 40 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources, Mineral processing, and Energy sector


Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Boilermaker Welder Apprenticeship
description_html:
A Boilermaker Welder Apprenticeship with Monadelphous will see you working at our Steel Fabrication & Construction workshop in Capel, WA called RTW. As an Apprentice you will combine paid work with hands-on training alongside experienced tradespeople, and strong construction and project management teams.

You will be well supported to complete your apprenticeship and successfully obtain your trade certificate.

Why Us?

We provide the benefits you’d expect from a leading Australian company, but what makes us different?
  • Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work on some of the world’s biggest resources, energy and infrastructure projects.
  • Our culture. We’re solution-focused, reliable and embrace a ‘can-do’ team environment.
  • Our loyalty. We want you to reach your potential, we’d like to help you get there.

What you will bring

  • Keen interest in completing a trade and becoming a qualified Boilermaker/Welder
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Pre-Apprenticeship (Certificate II in Engineering) or experience in heavy fabrication is beneficial
  • Local to Capel, WA

Life at Monadelphous

There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About us

RTW Steel Fabrication & Construction - A Monadelphous Company, is the South West's leading steel fabrication and construction company, specialising in high performance products that meet the demands of Western Australia's mining, industrial and commercial sectors. We assist our Clients to choose from the latest technology quality products, offer expert advice and deliver an efficient service with a strong focus on safety and achieving zero harm.

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

We have been part of the local community for over 35 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in civil, structural, mechanical and electrical capital projects, maintenance and industrial services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The safe way is the only way. We embrace the benefits of employing hardworking people from a range of backgrounds, so we encourage applications that contribute to our diverse workplace. If you would like to see our Diversity Policy, please visit our website.

title: Site Supervisor
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking an experienced Site Supervisor to join our NSW Operations team on a permanent basis.

This is a local role which will see you working on various Fixed Plant and CHPP sites across the Upper Hunter Valley Region, based out of the Mt Thorley Office.


Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Be home every night while living and working locally.
  • Opportunity for redeployment throughout the Monadelphous business.
  • Tool of Trade.
  • A strong safety-first culture and supportive team environment.

Key Responsibilities will include:
  • Supervise and coordinate daily activities of crews.
  • Ensure compliance with Monadelphous, client, and legislative HSE requirements.
  • Oversee planning, scheduling, and execution of shutdown tasks.
  • Maintain high standards of quality, safety, and environmental performance.
  • Lead by example and foster a positive team culture.

What you will bring:
  • 3 years minimum experience as a site-based supervisor.
  • Must hold Australian recognised Metal Trades Qualification – Mechanical Fitter or Boilermaker.
  • Fixed Plant and shutdown experience preferred.
  • The drive to get hands on and lead by example.
  • Strong ability to manage time to achieve tight deadlines.
  • Experience in effective planning, scheduling, budgets, variations, management of personnel, resources and equipment to meet Project requirements.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Australian working rights.

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About Us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the local community in the Hunter Valley and Newcastle region,
for over 16 years, proud to be providing jobs in Mining, Mineral processing, and Heavy Industry for this region.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. 

Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Electrical Estimator
description_html:
The role of an Electrical Estimator will see you working from our head office in Victoria Park, providing critical support in the preparation and submission of competitive tenders and proposals for our Engineering Construction division. 

You will be involved across the full tender lifecycle and will also involve close collaboration with project managers, engineers, planners, and commercial teams to ensure estimates are accurate, commercially sound, and aligned with delivery strategies. 

Our Engineering and Construction division provides large-scale multidisciplinary project management and construction services. Our delivery of high-quality work within the resources sector has earnt us a solid reputation and enviable relationships with some of the industry’s leading operators.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Working full-time, Monday to Friday in Victoria Park
  • Ongoing training, career development and regular performance plans to ensure your future and career goals are achieved
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture


Key Responsibilities:

  • Analysing qualitative and quantitative data for inclusion in tenders, including obtaining relevant information/data, calculating costings and providing advice and information
  • Provide expert electrical estimating advice to the business unit and assist with compiling major tenders, proposals and expressions of interest on behalf of the division.
  • Review tender documentation and calculate costings for submissions
  • Develop and review tenders and proposals for quality, risk, accuracy, and completeness; responding quickly to correct problems


What you’ll bring:

  • Relevant trade qualification
  • Relevant on-site industry experience in the resources, engineering or construction industry with a strong understanding of electrical trades and disciplines involved in site/project operations coupled with knowledge of relevant construction/maintenance norms and industry rates
  • A proven capability working within the engineering contracting sector servicing the resources, energy or infrastructure industries
  • Well-developed interpersonal and verbal communication skills to ensure effective communication with all levels of stakeholders
  • Advanced skills in use of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Adobe Acrobat Professional.
  • Self-motivated, career driven and have a passion for providing excellent customer service
  • Excellent written communication skills with high attention to detail, to accurately prepare and review content

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.


Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: HSE Coordinator
description_html:
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced HSE Coordinator to join our Corporate Services team based in our Victoria Park head office, supporting the HSE function. You will be working closely with key stakeholders influencing continuous improvements across internal HSE systems and initiatives.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Victoria Park location, with public transport and free parking close by
  • Permanent full-time position
  • Company benefits & discounts
Key Responsibilities:
  • Providing health, safety and environmental support to our Corporate division
  • Developing campaign material to promote HSE awareness
  • Ongoing HSE systems review, development and implementation including the identification and integration of lessons learned and best practice
  • HSE Systems reporting, analysis, audits, investigations and projects
  • Preparation and facilitation of Toolbox material, HSE presentations and workshops
  • Conducting HSE Incident investigations (TapRoot qualifications desirable)
  • Implementing HSE improvement projects in collaboration with our operating Divisions
  • Monitoring and communicating changes in health, safety and environmental legislation
What you’ll bring:
  • Degree in HSE or a related field is highly desirable
  • Experience in a similar role within construction and/or resource industry experience is advantageous
  • Flexibility for short-term site travel from time to time
  • Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work autonomously and show initiative with a strong work ethic

title: Estimator
description_html:
The role of an Estimator will see you working from our head office in Victoria Park, providing critical support in the preparation and submission of competitive tenders and proposals for our Engineering Construction division. 

You will be involved across the full tender lifecycle and will also involve close collaboration with project managers, engineers, planners, and commercial teams to ensure estimates are accurate, commercially sound, and aligned with delivery strategies. 

Our Engineering and Construction division provides large-scale multidisciplinary project management and construction services. Our delivery of high-quality work within the resources sector has earnt us a solid reputation and enviable relationships with some of the industry’s leading operators.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Working full-time, Monday to Friday in Victoria Park
  • Ongoing training, career development and regular performance plans to ensure your future and career goals are achieved
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture
Key Responsibilities:
  • Analysing qualitative and quantitative data for inclusion in tenders, including obtaining relevant information/data, calculating costings and providing advice and information
  • Provide expert estimating advice to the business unit and assist with compiling major tenders, proposals and expressions of interest on behalf of the division.
  • Review tender documentation and calculate costings for submissions
  • Develop and review tenders and proposals for quality, risk, accuracy, and completeness; responding quickly to correct problems
What you’ll bring:
  • Relevant trade qualification or Engineering degree
  • Relevant on-site industry experience in the resources, engineering or construction industry with a strong understanding of trades and disciplines involved in site/project operations coupled with knowledge of relevant construction/maintenance norms and industry rates
  • A proven capability working within the engineering contracting sector servicing the resources, energy or infrastructure industries
  • Well-developed interpersonal and verbal communication skills to ensure effective communication with all levels of stakeholders
  • Advanced skills in use of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Adobe Acrobat Professional.
  • Self-motivated, career driven and have a passion for providing excellent customer service
  • Excellent written communication skills with high attention to detail, to accurately prepare and review content
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Engineering Construction division is an increasingly diverse business, focusing on managing and delivering large-scale project management and construction services. Our expertise includes civil construction, structural steel fabrication, modularisation and delivery, as well as structural, mechanical, piping and tank construction. We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.



Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Electrician
description_html:
We are seeking an experienced Electrician to join our maintenance crew. This permanent position will see you working a Monday to Friday roster in Newcastle or 4 on, 2 off roster in the Hunter Valley. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include: 
  • 8-10-hour shifts, with overtime at double base rate
  • Opportunity for redeployment to other Monadelphous shutdowns 
  • Company car provided 

What you will bring:
  • NSW Certificate of Proficiency 
  • Working at Heights Ticket (Within 2 years) Highly regarded
  • Confined space (Within 2 years) Highly regarded
  • EWP highly regarded
  • Valid Australian Driver's Licence
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We're committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply. We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application. 

About Us 

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we've been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services. 

We've been part of the local community in the Hunter Valley and Newcastle region for over 16 years, proud to be providing jobs in Mining, Mineral Processing and Heavy Industry for this region.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Superintendent
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking an experienced Site Superintendent to join our NSW Operations on a Fixed Term Contract basis.


The role of Site Superintendent will see you working Monday to Friday multiple sites in the Hunter Valley, based out of the Mt Thorley Office.


Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include

  • 12 months contract 
  • Be home every night while living and working locally.
  • Relocation package for those willing to make the move to the Hunter Valley region.
  • Tool of Trade included in contract.


Key Responsibilities include

  • Work closely with the project teams to deliver a culture of excellence in HSSE, quality, productivity and performance
  • Foster relationships with internal and external customers to ensure contractual requirements are met
  • Effectively manage and provide leadership to the onsite supervisors and trades team
  • Assisting with planning and scheduling the scope of work, whilst ensuring works remain in line with the project budget
  • Identify and manage risk and changes in project requirements to ensure successful project delivery
  • Be the point of contact for project staff and client representatives for queries relating to technical or progress issues
  • Lead safety culture, initiatives and performance throughout

What you will bring 

  • Site based maintenance/shutdown experience in the mining industry
  • CHPP experience (highly desirable)
  • Australian recognised trade certificate or cert 4 in relevant disciplines (highly regarded)
  • Excellent working knowledge of trades and disciplines involved in project operations
  • Proven leadership skills, with the ability to motivate others
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
  • A commitment to ensuring a safe working environment. 

Life at Monadelphous

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.


We have been part of the local community in the Hunter Valley and Newcastle region, for over 16 years, proud to be providing jobs in Mining, Mineral processing, and Heavy Industry for this region.


Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Payroll Administration Lead
description_html:
As the Payroll Lead, you will be responsible for the end-to-end delivery of payroll across multiple projects while providing leadership, guidance and support to a team of Payroll Administrators. You will act as the key escalation point for payroll matters, ensure compliance and accuracy, and drive continuous improvement across payroll processes.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Manage and mentor Payroll Administrators while owning end-to-end payroll delivery
  • Long-term projects, strong pipeline of work and genuine leadership career pathways
  • Complex, multi-award payroll across major resources and energy projects
  • Safety-driven, collaborative environment that values accountability and continuous improvement
Key Responsibilities:
  • Leading and overseeing weekly payroll processing across multiple projects
  • Managing and supporting a team of Payroll Administrators, including task allocation, coaching and performance support
  • Ensuring payroll is processed accurately, on time and in line with awards, EBAs and legislative requirements
  • Reviewing, auditing and approving payroll data prior to submission
  • Acting as the primary escalation point for complex payroll, leave and timesheet queries
  • Coordinating payroll inputs including timesheets, allowances, cost coding and leave
  • Partnering with HR, Finance and Project teams to ensure payroll compliance and accuracy
  • Supporting project set-up and ensuring payroll processes are implemented consistently
  • Developing, maintaining and improving payroll procedures, reports and controls
  • Identifying and implementing process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy
  • Supporting audits and ensuring payroll documentation and controls are maintained
  • Occasional travel to onshore Oil & Gas facilities may be required
What you’ll bring:
  • Proven experience in a Payroll Lead, Payroll Supervisor or Payroll Team Lead role
  • Demonstrated experience managing and supporting payroll staff
  • Strong end-to-end payroll knowledge across weekly payroll cycles
  • Experience within resources, construction, engineering or project-based environments (highly regarded)
  • Strong understanding of payroll legislation, awards and EBAs
  • High attention to detail with excellent auditing and problem-solving skills
  • Confident stakeholder engagement across HR, Finance and project teams
  • Strong systems experience with payroll and time & attendance systems
  • Ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • A proactive, hands-on leadership style with a continuous improvement mindset
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.
description_text:
As the Payroll Lead, you will be responsible for the end-to-end delivery of payroll across multiple projects while providing leadership, guidance and support to a team of Payroll Administrators. You will act as the key escalation point for payroll matters, ensure compliance and accuracy, and drive continuous improvement across payroll processes.
Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
Manage and mentor Payroll Administrators while owning end-to-end payroll delivery
Long-term projects, strong pipeline of work and genuine leadership career pathways
Complex, multi-award payroll across major resources and energy projects
Safety-driven, collaborative environment that values accountability and continuous improvement
Key Responsibilities:
Leading and overseeing weekly payroll processing across multiple projects
Managing and supporting a team of Payroll Administrators, including task allocation, coaching and performance support
Ensuring payroll is processed accurately, on time and in line with awards, EBAs and legislative requirements
Reviewing, auditing and approving payroll data prior to submission
Acting as the primary escalation point for complex payroll, leave and timesheet queries
Coordinating payroll inputs including timesheets, allowances, cost coding and leave
Partnering with HR, Finance and Project teams to ensure payroll compliance and accuracy
Supporting project set-up and ensuring payroll processes are implemented consistently
Developing, maintaining and improving payroll procedures, reports and controls
Identifying and implementing process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy
Supporting audits and ensuring payroll documentation and controls are maintained
Occasional travel to onshore Oil & Gas facilities may be required
What you’ll bring:
Proven experience in a Payroll Lead, Payroll Supervisor or Payroll Team Lead role
Demonstrated experience managing and supporting payroll staff
Strong end-to-end payroll knowledge across weekly payroll cycles
Experience within resources, construction, engineering or project-based environments (highly regarded)
Strong understanding of payroll legislation, awards and EBAs
High attention to detail with excellent auditing and problem-solving skills
Confident stakeholder engagement across HR, Finance and project teams
Strong systems experience with payroll and time & attendance systems
Ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
A proactive, hands-on leadership style with a continuous improvement mindset
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application
About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.
Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.
We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.
Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise:
The Safe Way is the Only Way
. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Mechanical Fitter
description_html:
We are currently recruiting experienced, local Mechanical Fitters to join our team in the Hunter Valley, NSW.  You'll join an experienced, local team and support mechanical maintenance works, executing safely and efficiently.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Competitive rates
  • 10 to 12-hour days
  • Monday - Friday roster
  • Overtime shifts available
  • Upskilling and training plans
  • Opportunity for growth and advancement

What you will bring:

  • NSW Certificate of Proficiency for Cert III Fitting/Turning
  • Working at Heights Ticket (Within 2 years) Highly regarded
  • Confined space (Within 2 years) Highly regarded
  • Valid Australian Driver's Licence
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We're committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply. We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application. 

About Us 

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we've been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services. 

We've been part of the local community in the Hunter Valley and Newcastle region for over 16 years, proud to be providing jobs in Mining, Mineral Processing and Heavy Industry for this region.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

Recruitment Contact

Ash Napier | 0475 287 571 | misenswrecruit@monadel.com.au

title: Payroll Compliance Officer
description_html:
Payroll can be complex - and that’s exactly why we care about getting it right. We’re looking for a Payroll Compliance Officer with 1-3 years’ payroll experience who wants to step into a compliance-focused role supporting a large and dynamic payroll environment. You’ll work across various awards and agreements, statutory obligations and portable entitlements, helping ensure our payroll outcomes are accurate and compliant.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • A growth role that goes beyond payroll processing into compliance and governance.
  • Exposure to audits, statutory reporting and regulatory obligations.
  • Development pathway within a growing compliance team.
  • Supportive team that values accuracy, ownership, learning and continuous improvement.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Support compliance reviews, audits and data validation activities including regulator and scheme reviews.
  • Assist in processing superannuation contributions, month-end reporting performing reconciliations and investigate variances in payroll and employee data.
  • Prepare data for statutory and compliance reporting for Portable Long Service Leave (PLSL) returns across construction and building schemes.
  • Assist in coordination and review of international payroll, shadow payroll processes and reporting for overseas locations.
  • Work closely with other payroll team members finance and HR to improve activities.
  • Contribute to process improvements and clearer compliance documentation.
  • Assist in coordination of benefits for Fringe Benefits Tax annual returns.
  • Maintain compliance registers, trackers and supporting documentation.
  • Work as a committed member of the payroll team to maintain a strong service culture and support to the business.
What you’ll bring:
  • 1-3 years’ experience in payroll, tax, accounting or a compliance-related role - construction contracting exposure is highly regarded.
  • Confidence with payroll systems (Ascender by Dayforce is a strong advantage).
  • Familiarity with construction awards, EBAs or time-based payrolls is a strong advantage.
  • Strong attention to detail and confidence working with data - you care about accuracy and completeness.
  • Comfortable working with data and Excel (lookups, filters, pivots; power query a bonus).
  • Inquisitive, practical and comfortable asking questions to get to the right outcome. A willingness to learn is essential - be curious.
  • Ability to work under pressure and develop work strategies to achieve deadlines.
  • Keen to build a long-term career in payroll compliance or governance.
  • Experience with Portable LSL schemes (e.g. MyLeave, QLeave, NT Build etc), audits or statutory reporting is a bonus - but not essential. We’ll teach you.
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our corporate offices in Perth and Brisbane enable a wide range of professionals who provide the administration support and corporate services for the teams across Australia and internationally. Join a collaborative and fun team who are contributing to the success of our business every day.



Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Mechanical Coordinator
description_html:
We’re recruiting full-time Mechanical Coordinator to join our Onshore and Offshore Energy teams in Perth. This role will be responsible for executing maintenance work safely and efficiently in time with the right quality at optimal cost. This is a great opportunity to get your foot in the door if you are looking at getting into the Oil & Gas industry.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Salary sacrifice and novated leasing available
  • Discounted health insurance

Key Responsibilities:

  • Interface with operations, maintenance, engineering and outside vendors and subcontracted personnel to obtain specific information in relation to onshore maintenance requirements
  • Provide expert advice, support, technical or functional information (related to estimating and work pack preparation) as require
  • Development and coordination or work packs and supporting documentation to ensure efficient execution
  • Coordinating maintenance activities in accordance with client procedures and standard, through to implementation of maintenance execution plans
  • Overseeing the full spectrum of planning, taking into account materials, resourcing and equipment procurement
  • Maintaining and developing a knowledge base of maintenance management systems and planning tools with daily use of SAP

What you’ll bring:

  • Mechanical trade or engineering qualification
  • Experience with CMMS systems, preferably SAP
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.
Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.
We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.
Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise:
The Safe Way is the Only Way
. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Insulators
description_html:
We are seeking Insulators with a strong LNG and Construction background to assist with our Pluto Train 1 Modification Project in Karratha. The scope covers the modification of the plant to enable the processing of Scarborough gas and includes the installation and movement of three large modules, the installation and movement of three skids, installation of large bore piping, installation of two compressors. Works will be conducted within a live LNG plant (brownfields environment).

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • FIFO from Australian Capital Cities
  • Casual Position, 13 days on 1 day off
  • 5-6 week duration
  • Opportunity to join our growing construction division and be part of an exciting new project. 
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture 

What you’ll bring:
  • 2 years LNG relevant experience. 
  • Construction White Card. 
  • Driver's Licence. 
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. 
  • Proof of right to work in Australia. 

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

title: Electrical Field Engineer
description_html:
High Energy Service (HES), a Monadelphous Business, is currently seeking a motivated Electrical Engineer to join our Resources Team. Due to the nature of the role, the point of hire is required to be based in Perth and surrounding areas. This role is classified as a FIFO position with occasional Metro or Workshop posts as required.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Competitive remuneration packages that reward experience and competency
  • HES has a long-term sustainable business model that enables us to offer a full-time position with excellent, long-term job security
  • Extensive internal development and training opportunities allowing you to continually progress your career and capabilities
  • The working roster is flexible, enabling you to take control of your workload

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the production of design reports, testing, programming, and electrical design
  • Testing, commissioning, and maintenance of High Voltage assets
  • Performing shutdown works on mine sites in the Pilbara
  • Provide advice, technical or functional information as required to Supervision and project staff involved in the execution of work
  • Qualitative documentation - ITRs' and ITPs'
  • Identify hazards and advise on safety procedures. Actively monitor work practices to ensure adherence to correct procedures and standards for safety and environmental performance
  • Experience in customer communications
  • Commissioning experience

What you’ll bring:

  • Good knowledge of power systems and high voltage testing principles
  • A strong commitment to maintaining a safe working environment
  • Well-developed communication skills and a collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Strong written and technical skills, with a demonstrated capability in commercials, budgets, construction metrics, and change management
  • Tertiary Qualification in Engineering (Electrical or Power Systems)
  • Unrestricted WA Drivers Licence
  • Right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice. 

High Energy Service (HES) is a Monadelphous Business and one of Australia's leading high voltage service providers. Operating from a purpose-built facility in Wangara, we specialise in testing, maintenance, compliance, commissioning, installation and engineering for high voltage assets across mining, utilities and energy. With a team of more than 100 highly skilled professionals, HES is committed to developing its people and provides opportunities to grow your career wile working with industry-leading technology and projects.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Senior Advisor – Recruitment Marketing & Employer Brand
description_html:
We’re looking for a creative and organised Recruitment Marketing & Employer Brand Advisor to help us attract great people to our business. In this role, you’ll create engaging social media content, run recruitment advertising campaigns (mainly on social platforms), and work closely with our Recruitment and Marketing teams to bring our employer brand to life. You’ll help tell our story, promote our roles, and make sure the right people see the right opportunities.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work on some of the world’s biggest resources, energy, and infrastructure projects
  • Work closely with our Recruitment and Marketing teams to bring our employer brand to life
  • ASX listed company where you can build a career and lifetime networks
Key Responsibilities:
  • Create and post recruitment content on social media (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram)
  • Help plan and run paid recruitment advertising campaigns
  • Turn job needs and workforce plans into engaging content and campaigns
  • Work with teams across the business to collect photos, stories and content from sites and offices
  • Track how campaigns perform and use the results to improve future activity
  • Make sure all content is on brand and reflects who we are as an employer
  • Coordinate with external agencies and advertising partners when needed
What you’ll bring:
  • Must have digital marketing experience, particularly buying / managing digital marketing campaigns (across Meta, broader social media, Google adwords etc.) 
  • Experience in recruitment marketing, employer branding or social media marketing
  • Confidence creating content (written and visual)
  • Experience running paid social media advertising campaigns
  • An organised, proactive approach and ability to manage multiple priorities
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset
  • Marketing automation and CRM experience advantageous
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our corporate offices in Perth and Brisbane enable a wide range of professionals who provide the administration support and corporate services for the teams across Australia and internationally. Join a collaborative and fun team who are contributing to the success of our business every day.



Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Electrical Supervisor
description_html:
Zenviron is growing and we’re looking for an experienced Electrical Supervisor to support the delivery of large scale Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) projects in Victoria’s Latrobe Valley. 

This is a hands on leadership role where you’ll coordinate and supervise on site electrical works, lead crews and subcontractors, and work closely with project teams to deliver safe, high quality outcomes across critical major BESS projects in the Latrobe Valley. 

Key responsibilities will include: 

  • Plan, allocate and coordinate daily work activities for electrical crews and subcontractors 
  • Supervise, coach and mentor team members, ensuring competency and compliance with scope and standards. 
  • Manage subcontractors and suppliers to ensure works are delivered in line with project requirements, schedules and specifications. 
  • Promote and maintain a strong safety culture, always ensuring compliance with Zenviron and site safety requirements. 

What we are looking for: 

  • Minimum 4 years site base Supervisory experience within the substation, renewable energy or construction industry. 
  • An Australian recognised Electrical Trade Certificate and Licence. 
  • Demonstrable experience in Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) or experience in Substation construction, including installation, testing and commissioning of high voltage electrical work (highly regarded). 
  • Strong ability to manage time to achieve tight deadlines. 
  • Experience in effective planning, scheduling, budgets, variations, management of personnel, resources and equipment to meet Project requirements. 
  • Excellent written and technical skills and a confident user of MS Office Suite. 
  • An innovative approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement. 
  • Driven commitment to maintaining a safe working environment. 
  • Proof of right to work in Australia. 

To be successful in this role you will require well-developed interpersonal skills to assist you in building effective stakeholder relationships both internally and externally, whilst you will demonstrate a team orientated approach to work and commitment to continuous improvement. Through utilising your time management skills, you will have the ability to manage multiple aspects of work concurrently, and for this we offer an attractive remuneration package. 

We are committed to our philosophy of Empowering People and encourage innovation and creative thinking. We embrace the benefits of employing hardworking people from rich and varied backgrounds, so we encourage applications that contribute to our diverse workplace. 

We understand the importance of recognising each and every member of staff, that’s why at Zenviron your talents will be encouraged to make a valued contribution to the project and the organisation. 

About us 

Zenviron is a joint venture between Monadelphous and ZEM Energy and is a market leading engineering, procurement and construction services contractor, specialising in the design and construction of large-scale renewable energy projects in Australia.

title: Electricians
description_html:
Jump into our March shutdown at RIO Brockman with future shutdowns available within our Pilbara Region!

Shutdown involves conveyor tie works, upgrades to motors, VSDs and Transformers. With mid‑year opportunities to join our major construction at RIO Brockman Syncline 1 on a 2:1 basis, Monadelphous will keep you busy!


RIO Brockman Shutdown

March 20th – 3rd April

March 27th – 13th April

**please note due to shutdown requirements dates are subject to change


Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • FIFO from Perth or nearest capital city
  • 12-hour shifts (day/night available during shutdown period)
  • Site allowance, casual loading, and attractive penalty rates on offer
  • Opportunity to join our growing construction division and be part of an exciting new project 
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture


What you'll bring

  • Extensive construction experience - minimum of 2 years
  • Proof of full working rights in Australia
  • A-Grade WA Electrical Licence
  • Construction White Card
  • CPR/LVR (1-year validity)
  • First Aid (3-year validity)  
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Willing to be clean shaven for respiratory fit testing 

Highly Desirable:

  • Rio Tinto Inductions & Training 
  • High Risk Licence (EWP)
  • Basic Fire (5-year validity)


Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Engineering Construction division is an increasingly diverse business, focusing on managing and delivering large-scale project management and construction services. Our expertise includes civil construction, structural steel fabrication, modularisation and delivery, as well as structural, mechanical, piping and tank construction. We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours!

title: Site Manager
description_html:
Monadelphous are seeking a motivated Site Manager to join our PNG operations team, based on-site in Lihir, PNG on a 21:21 FIFO roster.

To be considered for this role, you will have previous experience managing project execution teams and subcontractors as well as the ability to liaise daily with on-site and offsite client representatives. Well-developed communication skills and the ability to prepare correspondence and reports are essential, as is high levels of self-motivation to coordinate the site activities of a team.

Key responsibilities and requirements of the role include:
  • Adaptable and flexible to change depending on client requirements.
  • A customer-centric mindset and strong value of safety.
  • Implementing and managing construction activities to ensure compliance with HSE standards, regulations and practices.
  • Planning and scheduling the scope of work for the project.
  • Support the Project Manager with project commercials, budgets/construction metrics, forecasting and change management.
  • Lead from the front in promoting an innovative culture and supporting the ongoing development of our PNG citizen employees.
  • An innovative approach to problem solving, continuous improvement and successful delivery methods.
  • Oversee the planning, organising and mobilisation of all resources of labour, equipment, materials and consumables for site jobs.
  • Manage multiple projects achieving high performance.

What you will bring
  • Tertiary or Trade qualifications in a relevant discipline.
  • Previous PNG experience in the mining and, or Oil and Gas sectors.
  • Extensive construction or maintenance background within the resources industry.
  • An innovative approach to continuous improvement and successful delivery methods.
  • Strong understanding in commercials, budgets/construction metrics, estimating, forecasting and change management involving changes to scope, quantities and timeframes.
  • Well-developed written and verbal communication skills, with ability to effectively prepare correspondence, reports and instructions.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstratable experience in driving high performance teams.
  • Proof of right to work in Australia and a valid passport.

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About Us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been operating in Papua New Guinea over 18 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in structural, mechanical, piping, electrical, civil, and other large-scale services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: HSE Advisor
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking an experienced HSE Advisor to join our Chinchilla-based team on a permanent basis, supporting operations across the Surat Basin.

This is a local role offering stability, career development, and the benefit of being home every night.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

• Opportunity for growth and career development.
• Local role – no FIFO, be home every night.
• Supportive team environment.

Responsibilities will include:

• Leading toolbox meetings and safety conversations.
• Creation of HSE work packs.
• Assisting in the writing and presenting of HSE reports.
• Development and implementation of HSE management plans.
• Conducting incident investigations.
• Providing HSE advice.
• Reviewing and creating work permits and JHA’s/ SWMS.
• Conducting audits.

What you will bring

• Minimum 3 years’ site-based experience in a HSE role within the resources industry, preferably within Oil and Gas maintenance.
• Minimum diploma in OHS or higher.
• Strong understanding and working knowledge of appropriate Australian Safety legislation, standards and codes.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
• Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and other relevant software.
• Commitment to safety and compliance.
• Proof of right to work in Australia.

Life at Monadelphous

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

iPipe Services is a specialist in the construction and maintenance of pipelines, wellhead and compression facilities. Based in Chinchilla, Queensland, our team provides services to the energy, resources and utility sectors.

title: Personal Assistant
description_html:
We are seeking a Personal Assistant to join our M&IS Energy Business Unit supporting the General Manager. This integral position will entail joining a cohesive team who are directly impacting the success of the business every day. In this role, you will gain exposure to a range of diverse and interesting tasks within the business unit whilst working with a supportive team who are passionate about delivering to our business.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Permanent position
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Flexible working hours
  • Perth based, Monday-Friday role
Key Responsibilities:
  • Provide effective administrative and secretarial services directly to the General Manager including diary/email management and travel coordination
  • Arranging meetings (collecting visitors, setting up supplies, presentations etc. in meeting rooms)
  • Prepare and distribute reports, presentations, organisational charts and various document formatting
  • Order, assign and registering of stock for the business unit
  • Prepare information for dissemination to others; maintain and update records
  • Provide a timely response to information requests from clients, suppliers, divisional services and the project teams
  • Create, update and maintain SharePoint pages and online databases
  • Workshop and meeting room management
  • Creating Power Point presentations
  • Maintain time sheets, expense claims and business cards for assigned Managers and direct reports
  • Receive, screen and monitor assigned Managers incoming telephone calls
  • Greet and welcome clients and external visitors
  • Expenditure management and reconciliation
  • General administration tasks including amenity procurement and IT management
What you’ll bring:
  • A minimum of 3 years demonstrated experience in a PA/EA capacity ideally whilst working for similar resources companies
  • Professionalism and confidence dealing with Executive Level Management
  • Advanced Microsoft and IT skills (Excel, Word, Visio, Powerpoint, SharePoint, MS Teams)
  • Ability to cooperate with others to move the team toward the completion of goals
  • Capability to adapt to change, can work well under pressure and persist toward goals despite obstacles
  • Initiative to set and achieve work goals for yourself
  • Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities
  • Strong attention to detail, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • High level of time management and the ability to handle a fluctuating workload
  • Self-motivated, career driven and have a passion for providing excellent customer service
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our corporate offices in Perth and Brisbane enable a wide range of professionals who provide the administration support and corporate services for the teams across Australia and internationally. Join a collaborative and fun team who are contributing to the success of our business every day.



Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Senior Electrical Supervisor
description_html:
We have an outstanding opportunity for an experienced Senior Electrical Supervisor to join our Gladstone Operations team, based on Curtis Island, QLD.

This is a permanent, site-based role supporting the delivery of the mid-stream operations, working a 9-day fortnight roster.  Please note this is a local role.

You will carry out a wide range of tasks across project activities from planning, coordinating and supervising daily activities of work crews, working closely with the projects team ensuring requirements of the project are met.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Permanent full-time position.
  • Be home every night while living and working locally.
  • Opportunity for redeployment throughout the Monadelphous business
  • Engaging and diverse work across long term contracts
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture

Key Responsibilities will include:

  • Allocate work and provide direction to relevant trades specific work requirements.
  • Supervise, coach and mentor direct reports; ensure that site workers have the necessary competencies to undertake assigned tasks.
  • Communicate with client representatives on a day-to-day basis, to plan work, keep them informed of progress, resolve any issues of concern and identify variations or additional work required.

What you will bring:

  • Minimum 4 years extensive Supervisory experience in the Oil & Gas sector is highly desirable
  • QLD Electrical Trade and current licence.
  • Must hold current EEHA.
  • Cert IV in Electrical Instrumentation – desirable.
  • Experience leading a team of electrical workers ranging from Electrical tradespersons, Apprentices and electrical trades assistants
  • The drive to get hands on and lead by example
  • Strong ability to manage time to achieve tight deadlines
  • Experience in effective planning, scheduling, budgets, variations, management of personnel, resources and equipment to meet Project requirements
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.
