We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the Gladstone community for over 40 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources, Mineral processing, and Energy sector.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours

title: Mechanical Coordinator
description_html:
Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in the planning, management and execution of maintenance, shutdowns and sustaining capital works. Our delivery of high-quality work within the oil and gas sector has earnt us a solid reputation and enviable relationships with some of the industry’s leading operators. We are looking for a Mechanical Coordinator to works across the following scope based on the allocated work group: Mechanical Static, High and Low Speed Rotating, Pumps and Engines and PSV’s.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work on some of the world’s biggest resources, energy and infrastructure projects
  • Our culture. We’re solution focused, reliable and embrace a ‘can-do’ team environment
  • Our loyalty. We want you to reach your potential, we’d like to help you get there

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for delivery of Mechanical maintenance services in line with business processes and schedule/cost objectives whilst maintaining compliance with the Contract HSSE, Quality and Employee Relations Management Plans
  • Building Campaign work packs and ensure materials meet schedule execution time frame and reschedule where required
  • Work with schedulers to assist with schedule loading and advise criticality of work scope prior to revision lock
  • Arrange vendor mobilisation and ensure relevant competencies are up to date
  • Maintain equipment BOM via cataloguing and MOC process
  • Identify packages of work and liaise with other discipline planners/coordinators to maximise maintenance efficiency and minimise equipment down time
  • Ensure maintenance plans and MWI’s are fit for purpose. Liaise with relevant discipline engineers and implement changes via MOC process
  • Assist in the preparation of Permits, Rick Assessments and HAZOPS/HAZIDS as required
  • Liaise with Engineering, Vendors and Suppliers as required for progression of work scopes
  • Attend site for pre-scoping, walk down of scope and Kick-off/start of major campaigns as required
  • Complete After-Action Reviews (AAR) on campaign and produce lessons learned. Raise MOC/TSR as required to update systems, processes and SAP data
  • Monitor, review and keep client systems up to date including Task List, planning strategies and work packs
  • Demonstrates commitment to and drive a culture of strict compliance with the Life Saving Rules and adherence to the Monadelphous principle of The Safe Way is the Only Way
  • Participates and engage in safety interactions and field leadership
  • Practically implement the continuous improvement and lessons learned programs on a Contract-wide basis
  • Monitors compliance with all statutory and regulatory requirements and ensures that such requirements are known to all supervisors and staff and always complied with

What you’ll bring:

  • Mechanical Trade or Engineering Qualification
  • Extensive working knowledge and experience with SAP PM (required)
  • Experience with Low-Speed Rotating equipment, pumps and engines (required)
  • Oil & Gas experience, preferably offshore
  • Experience throughout work life cycle, building work packs, planning/scheduling and site execution
  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate across all levels

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours. it yours.

title: Project Administrator
description_html:
Monadelphous are seeking a highly motivated Project Administrator to join our PNG operations team on a full time basis. This role will be based in the Brisbane Office Monday to Friday, with the occasional requirement for site visits to Papua New Guinea.

Key responsibilities include:
  • Booking and coordination of employee travel
  • Data entry from variety of information sources
  • Procurement and invoicing
  • Assisting the project team with the generation and updating of internal and external reports
  • Provision of administrative support to project team
  • Subcontractor claim management
  • Monitoring and reporting project costs
  • Monitoring purchase orders and deliveries

What you will bring
  • A Minimum of 2+ years in a Project Administration function within the Engineering or Construction Industry
  • Proficient user of MS Office Suite (including Excel)
  • Demonstrable experience in travel booking and diary management
  • Excellent attention to detail; process driven to meet compliance standards
  • Ability to work as part of a team, and autonomously
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to liaise confidently with internal teams and develop strong relationships
  • Ability to prioritise workloads and help others when needed
  • Experience using cost management systems, JDE and SAP (highly regarded)
  • Proof of right to work in Australia and a valid passport

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About Us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been operating in Papua New Guinea over 18 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in structural, mechanical, piping, electrical, civil, and other large-scale services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Quality Coordinator - Expressions of Interest
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking Expressions of Interest from experienced Quality Coordinators to support upcoming works in South Australia. 

The successful applicant will be responsible for ensuring that all work is completed safely, on schedule and to client specifications. You will be managing, implementing and monitoring quality systems, training and qualifying welding personnel and supervising/conducting inspections of welding activities.

This position will initially be office-based, supporting the planning phase prior to site mobilisation:
Planning Phase: Commencing mid-March, Brisbane office, working Monday to Friday.
Execution Phase: Mobilise to site mid-May, working 2/2 roster.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Opportunity for growth and career development.
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture.
  • Supportive team environment.

Key Responsibilities include:
  • Actively communicating and contributing towards a positive Quality culture.
  • Working with Leads to identify improvement opportunities and drive to implement plans to achieve quality project delivery.
  • Coordinating the management of quality delivery, from kick off through to close out, working closely with the Quality Sponsors, Captains and Action Owners.
  • Maintaining and monitoring Quality systems and procedures.
  • Working with planners for the completions process of scopes and work packs.
  • Providing updates during the review audit on progress.
  • Communicating delivery progress to the Construction Team and relevant stakeholders.
  • Raising Non-Conformance Reports

What you will bring
  • Previous experience working in the resources sector in a Quality role.
  • An understanding of quality systems, processes, audits and general requirements for the construction and maintenance industries.
  • Cert 10 Welding QA.
  • Confident user of MS Office Suite.
  • Well-developed communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.
  • A motivated and proactive approach to quality management and reporting.
  • The ability to obtain relevant information, identify key issues and relationships, compare data from different sources and identify cause-effect relationships.
  • A clear commitment to maintaining a safe working environment.
  • Proof of right to work in Australia.

title: Mechanical Supervisors - Expressions of Interest
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking Expressions of Interest from experienced Mechanical Supervisor for upcoming work in South Australia commencing mid-May 2026.

The successful applicant will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and supervising daily activities of work crews.  Working 2:2 roster, flights from Brisbane are first preference.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Opportunity for growth and career development.
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture.
  • Supportive team environment.

Key Responsibilities include:
  • Supervise and coordinate daily activities of mechanical crews.
  • Ensure compliance with Monadelphous, client, and legislative HSE requirements.
  • Oversee planning, scheduling, and execution of tasks.
  • Maintain high standards of quality, safety, and environmental performance.
  • Lead by example and foster a positive team culture.

What you will bring
  • 3 years minimum experience working in the resources sector in a site-based supervisor role.
  • Australia recognised Mechanical Fitter or Boilermaker trade certificate (mandatory).
  • Proven ability to manage multidiscipline work crews.
  • Confident user of MS Office Suite.
  • Well-developed communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong leadership, planning, and time management skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
  • A clear commitment to maintaining a safe working environment.
  • Proof of right to work in Australia.

title: Scaffold Coordinator
description_html:
Monadelphous is looking for a Scaffolding Coordinator to join our onshore Energy division on a Monday to Friday basis in Darwin NT.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Darwin based role
  • Salary sacrifice and novated leasing available
  • Discounted health insurance

Key Responsibilities:

  • Interface with operations, maintenance, engineering and outside vendors and subcontracted personnel to obtain specific information in relation to onshore maintenance requirements
  • Provide expert advice, support, technical or functional information (related to estimating and work pack preparation) as required
  • Planning and organising work to meet contract schedule and maximise efficiency and productivity of the workforce. Conducting Risk assessments, preparing and ensuring permits are correct for task
  • Development and coordination or work packs and supporting documentation to ensure efficient execution
  • Coordinating maintenance activities in accordance with client procedures and standard, through to implementation of maintenance execution plans
  • Maintaining and developing a knowledge base of maintenance management systems and planning tools with daily use of SAP
  • Overseeing the full spectrum of planning, taking into account materials, resourcing and equipment procurement

What you’ll bring:

  • Current High Risk Workers Licence SA. Additional RA HRWL highly desirable
  • Experience with scaffold compliance tracking systems
  • Knowledge and experience creating detailed scaffolding work packs
  • Knowledge and experience creating manning profiles and rosters
  • Experience with CMMS systems, preferably SAP
  • Proficiency in the use of key Microsoft products (Word & Excel)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.

title: Materials Coordinator
description_html:
We’re recruiting a Materials Coordinator to join our Energy team supporting client’s offshore turnaround, commencing in mid-2026. This role will be responsible for the execution of all supply chain strategies and to ensure all consumables, materials and rental equipment are available to the turnaround in line with the schedule.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Based at client office before transitioning to offshore rotation during Turnaround execution.
  • Salary sacrifice and novated leasing available
  • Discounted health insurance
  • Work on a Word Class FLNG project

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide logistical and material support to offshore execution team
  • Examines materials, products, or work outputs for quality, accuracy, and completeness; responds quickly to correct quality problems
  • Manifesting outbound goods in conjunction with SAP
  • Provide expert advice, service support, technical or functional information to customers and business partners in relation to material management
  • Support implementation group with material queries and delivery issues
  • Understanding of Dangerous Goods by Sea
  • Has contact with client representatives and sub contractors in relation to specific projects and materials orders
  • Review and monitor Materials Status Report and communicate issues to Planners, Coordinators, Schedulers, procurement and expediting teams
  • Overseeing resourcing, material procurement, warehouse, rental and material loadout strategies

What you’ll bring:

  • Good understanding of material certification requirements
  • Willingness to travel to site as per business requirements
  • Experience with CMMS systems, preferably SAP
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

title: BMWs, Riggers / Scaffolders, Painter / Blasters & Mechanical Fitters
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently recruiting Boilermakers / Welders, Riggers and Scaffolders, Painter / Blasters and Mechanical Fitters to join our shutdown teams across the Pilbara. With Perth and Port Hedland point of hire, these roles offer a variety of shutdowns across a range of sites. Specific dates include the following:

February/March

2nd – 9th, 8th – 14th, 10th – 24th, 14th – 20th, 18th - 24th, 24th - 7th, 25th – 6th   

March/April

7th – 21st, 29th – 7th

April/May

1st – 9th, 9th – 17th, 14th – 25th, 28th – 8th

May

17th – 24th

June

16th – 30th

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division is known for top-quality work in mining maintenance, shutdowns, and sustaining capital works. We’ve earned strong, long-lasting relationships with industry leaders because we focus on getting the job done right, safely, and efficiently.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include;

  • Ongoing shutdown swings across a range of sites for blue chip iron ore Customers
  • Safety and Wellbeing: Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way
  • Team Culture: Join a supportive, collaborative team. We’re all about being solution-focused, reliable, and supporting one another with a positive, can-do attitude.
  • Growth & Loyalty: We’ll help you reach your potential, providing the support you need to grow and succeed.


What you will bring:

  • Experience in iron ore mining or equivalent
  • Australian recognised Trade Certificate (as applicable to your role)
  • Working at Heights (valid within 5 years) 
  • Enter and Work in Confined Space (valid within 5 years) 
  • Gas Test Atmospheres (valid within 5 years)
  • Basic Fire (valid within 5 years) 
  • High Risk Work Licence (as applicable to your role)
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • White Card
  • BHP & FMG inducted (highly desirable)
  • Proof of right to work in Australia


Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

2nd – 9th, 8th – 14th, 10th – 24th, 14th – 20th, 18th - 24th, 24th - 7th, 25th – 6th
March/April
7th – 21st, 29th – 7th
April/May
1st – 9th, 9th – 17th, 14th – 25th, 28th – 8th
May
17th – 24th
June
16th – 30th
Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division is known for top-quality work in mining maintenance, shutdowns, and sustaining capital works. We’ve earned strong, long-lasting relationships with industry leaders because we focus on getting the job done right, safely, and efficiently.
Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include;
Ongoing shutdown swings across a range of sites for blue chip iron ore Customers
Safety and Wellbeing: Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way
Team Culture: Join a supportive, collaborative team. We’re all about being solution-focused, reliable, and supporting one another with a positive, can-do attitude.
Growth & Loyalty: We’ll help you reach your potential, providing the support you need to grow and succeed.
What you will bring:
Experience in iron ore mining or equivalent
Australian recognised Trade Certificate (as applicable to your role)
Working at Heights (valid within 5 years)
Enter and Work in Confined Space (valid within 5 years)
Gas Test Atmospheres (valid within 5 years)
Basic Fire (valid within 5 years)
High Risk Work Licence (as applicable to your role)
Valid Australian Driver’s License
White Card
BHP & FMG inducted (highly desirable)
Proof of right to work in Australia
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.
Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

title: Graduate Engineer
description_html:
Join the Monadelphous Graduate Program and embark on a dynamic two-year journey to launch your engineering career. As a Graduate, you'll work on real projects, gaining hands-on experience in a Project Engineer role. You’ll work both on-site and in the office between projects, collaborating closely with your team to gain hands-on experience in project delivery and management.

Regardless of your engineering discipline whether  Civil or Mechanical you’ll gain valuable exposure to all areas of project engineering. You’ll work on large-scale projects that integrate multiple disciplines, giving you insight into how each one contributes to the overall success. This hands-on experience will help you develop a comprehensive understanding of project engineering within the resources sector.  

Joining our Graduate Program offers you a unique opportunity to fast-track your career with hands-on experience and strong support. As a Graduate, you will have:

  • Opportunity to work on-site, gaining practical experience in project engineering.
  • Ongoing support from a Project Manager, Supervisor, and Graduate buddy.
  • Receive ongoing development through structured Learning & Development modules, workshops, and courses.
  • Benefit from regular catch-ups with the Graduate Team and the chance to network with peers at our annual Graduate Forum.
  • Develop leadership skills and contribute to real-world projects that drive innovation within the industry.
  • The opportunity to participate in a formal Graduate Mentoring Program.
  • Rotations through various business areas, to broaden your skills and explore different career paths regardless of whether your background is in Engineering or Construction Management.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Work with the Project Manager to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet safety and quality standards.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, subcontractors, and internal teams.
  • Manage sub-contractors across various disciplines to ensure alignment with project goals.
  • Assist in preparing project estimates, tender submissions, and developing project schedules.
  • Support all phases of the project lifecycle, including tendering, planning, execution, and HSE compliance.
  • Collaborate with the Operational team to ensure a team-oriented approach to project delivery.
  • Manage project scope, schedule, and budgets as required, ensuring effective execution.

What you’ll bring:

  • Australian or New Zealand Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency or suitable Visa with working rights.
  • An Engineering degree (Bachelor or higher) within Mechanical or Civil with previous work experience through vacation work or similar, in Australia or New Zealand.
  • Living in Morwell / Latrobe Valley area.
  • Previous work experience within your chosen field through internships or equivalent is highly desirable.
  • A passion for the work we do and the desire to do real hands-on work in the field


Life at Monadelphous 

There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

title: Mechanical Project Engineer
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking an experienced Mechanical Project Engineer to provide engineering and project management support to our Midstream Operations based on Curtis Island, Gladstone.

This is a permanent, site-based role supporting the delivery of brownfield and operational projects reporting to the Project Manager, working a 9-day fortnight roster.

As a Mechanical Project Engineer, you will work closely with site teams, contractors, and clients to ensure projects are delivered safely, on time, and within budget. This is a hands-on, site-based role offering the opportunity to live and work locally in the Gladstone region.


Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Permanent full-time position
  • Be home every night while living and working locally.
  • Opportunity for growth and career opportunities
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture

Key responsibilities will include:
  • Complete material take-off and execute procurement.
  • Tendering/Estimating and methodology development.
  • Perform project control functions – scheduling, cost control including managing performance against budget and developing variations where required.
  • Contract administration of assigned projects.
  • Develop work packages for field teams to execute including all necessary QA documentation, development of ITPs and associated check sheets.
  • Participate in client/contractor meetings and resolve any project management issues.

What you will bring
  • Site based experience in the Oil and Gas industry highly regarded.
  • Tertiary qualification in Engineering Mechanical.
  • Ability to read and interpret technical drawings and specifications including 3D Models, GAs, Isometrics and P&IDs.
  • Confident user of MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Project).
  • Strong understanding of project management principles.
  • A strong commitment to maintaining a safe working environment.
  • Ideally, experience working in an on-site engineering position, servicing the resources sector
  • A strong commitment to maintaining a safe working environment.

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application. 

About Us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the Gladstone community for over 40 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources, Mineral processing, and Energy sector

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
description_html:
Our internal recruitment team consists of 120+ personnel across our Perth and Brisbane offices. We go above and beyond daily for our candidates and deliver a high volume of quality hires each month to ensure Monadelphous always delivers for our customers. We consider recruitment as the 'engine room' to Monadelphous and due to continued growth, we are looking for Talent Acquisition Specialists to join our team. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is looking to make a shift to internal recruitment or to further develop their recruitment skillset while working for a leading tier one contractor. With a proactive approach, you will effortlessly navigate demanding recruitment markets, ensuring Monadelphous remains the coveted "employer of choice" while securing exceptional talent. This role will work directly with senior stakeholders and offer unparalleled exposure to project teams, allowing continuous learning opportunities and enhance decision making skills. We offer a hands on training & development approach with career progression opportunities.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • On-site gym & facilities
  • Corporate discounts and company benefits
  • Career progression opportunities
  • Joining an established team that will offer you mentorship and support
Key Responsibilities:
  • Sourcing and onboarding of suitably qualified and experienced candidates and talent pipelining across various business units
  • Managing the end-to-end recruitment process including job briefs, proactive candidate sourcing and advertising, shortlisting, interviewing, and managing the background check process.
  • Uphold effective communication to senior internal stakeholders in relation to position and candidate status, updates, and application outcomes
  • Coordinate with Recruitment Support Officers to handover onboarding requirements including, pre-employment checks, pre-employment medical, ordering of PPE and mobilisation training requirements
  • Opportunity to work across multiple projects and business units
What you’ll bring:
  • Team focused approach, promoting a positive and engaging work environment
  • Experience with proactive sourcing and candidate engagement allowing you to identify prospective talent for the business' current and future talent needs.
  • The ability to deliver high volume recruitment objectives
  • A forward-thinking approach to sourcing talent while maintaining a general understanding of organisational fundamentals, models, and people management principles
  • A personalised customer service approach, both to internal personnel and candidates
  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment with flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and business requirements
  • Ability to build rapport quickly and effectively with varying stakeholders with an understanding of their project needs
  • Ability to take on initiative and proactively identify solutions
  • Relevant Tertiary Qualification
  • Bachelor Degree or higher
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our corporate offices in Perth and Brisbane enable a wide range of professionals who provide the administration support and corporate services for the teams across Australia and internationally. Join a collaborative and fun team who are contributing to the success of our business every day.



Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Project Engineer
description_html:
Monadelphous are seeking an experienced Project Engineer to join our PNG Operations team, based on site in Papua New Guinea, on a 21:21 FIFO roster. 

This high paced position will provide technical expertise across project management, estimating, procurement, contractual correspondence, quality assurance, and internal/external stakeholder management.

Key responsibilities include:
  • Preparing budget estimates for time, resources, equipment and materials
  • Developing project deliverables for site execution including work packs, QAQC documentation, execution methodologies and schedules
  • Requesting quotes from and managing sub-contractors relevant to the project
  • Interpret drawings and review scopes of work to ensure it is reflected in pricing and project execution
  • Maintain, track and report on project progress and performance
  • Provide engineering technical support for construction team

What you will bring:
  • An Australian recognised tertiary qualification in Engineering
  • Experience working in an on-site engineering position, servicing the resources sector
  • Proven experience preparing project budgets, managing cost and progress claims (highly regarded)
  • Strong, clear written and technical skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Confident user of MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
  • A strong commitment to maintaining a safe working environment
  • Excellent time management skills and demonstrable experience achieving tight deadlines
  • Proof of right to work in Australia and a valid passport

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About Us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been operating in Papua New Guinea over 18 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in structural, mechanical, piping, electrical, civil, and other large-scale services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Mechanical Fitter
description_html:
We are currently recruiting experienced Mechanical Fitters to join our team in Narrabi, NSW.  You'll join an experienced, local team and support mechanical maintenance works, executing safely and efficiently.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Competitive rates
  • 10 to 12-hour days
  • Monday - Friday roster
  • Overtime shifts available
  • Upskilling and training plans
  • Opportunity for growth and advancement

What you will bring:

  • NSW Certificate of Proficiency for Cert III Fitting/Turning
  • Working at Heights Ticket (Within 2 years) Highly regarded
  • Confined space (Within 2 years) Highly regarded
  • Valid Australian Driver's Licence
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

  • Working at Heights Ticket (Within 2 years) Highly regarded
  • Confined space (Within 2 years) Highly regarded
  • Valid Australian Driver's Licence
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We're committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply. We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application. 

About Us 

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we've been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services. 

We've been part of the local community in the Hunter Valley and Newcastle region for over 16 years, proud to be providing jobs in Mining, Mineral Processing and Heavy Industry for this region.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

Ash Napier | 0475 287 571 | misenswrecruit@monadel.com.au

title: Shutdown Trades

If you live locally and have experience in the following disciplines, we'd love to hear from you:

title: Store Person/Trade Assistant
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking a local experienced Store Person to join our team at Mt Thorley. This position will have the ideal applicant operating the store at the Mt Thorley yard for approximately 3 months before transitioning into a predominately site-based Trade Assistant role. In the store, roster is Monday to Friday 8 hour days. After moving to the site-role hours have potential to extend to 10-12 hour shifts.

The Position:

• Inventory Management
• Record Keeping
• Responsible for securing the yard
• Uploading/ Loading Deliveries
• Material receivables/ Material certification & Inspection and dispatch, 
• Assist with calibrations
• General housekeeping

What you will bring:

• Previous experience in inventory management and warehouse operations.
• Must hold a valid Australian High Risk Workers Licence – LF
• Strong knowledge of tooling and mining consumables
• Proficiency in using inventory tracking software.
• Strong organizational and time-management skills.
• Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
• Problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
• Knowledge of safety procedures and guidelines.

About Us?

We provide the benefits you’d expect from a leading Australian company, but what makes us different?
• Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work with top-tier client partners on great projects.
• Our culture. We’re solution focused, reliable and embrace a ‘can-do’ team environment.
• Our loyalty. You’ll reach your potential with Monos by your side all the way.

Across the Monadelphous workforce, you will find stories of people who took an opportunity to make a difference with us and built a career and lifetime friendships as a result. We employ nearly 6,000 highly skilled people who contribute positively to our operations and the communities in which we operate. Ours is a culture built over nearly 50 years, and it’s the reason for our continued success.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The safe way is the only way. We embrace the benefits of employing hardworking people from a range of backgrounds, so we encourage applications that contribute to our diverse workplace. 

A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

Recruitment Contacts:

Brisbane Recruitment: 07 3368 6077

Ash Napier: 0475 287 571 - misenswrecruit@monadel.com.au

title: Crane & Rigging Supervisor
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking an experienced Cranes & Rigging Supervisor to join our Gladstone Operations team, based on Curtis Island, QLD. 

This is a local-only opportunity on a casual contract, working Monday to Friday on a 9 day fortnight.

In this role, you’ll support Turnaround activities by planning, coordinating and supervising daily work crews, while ensuring compliance and safety remain at the forefront. You’ll work closely with the Turnaround Coordinator/Manager to deliver safe, efficient and high-quality project outcomes.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Be home every night while living and working locally.
  • Opportunity for growth and career development.
  • Engaging and diverse work across long term contracts.
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture.

Key responsibilities will include:
  • Ensure crane, scaffolding and rigging activities are completed safely and meet the schedule, respecting the critical path and deadlines.
  • Allocate work and provide direction to relevant trades specific work requirements.
  • Supervise, coach and mentor direct reports; ensure that site workers have the necessary competencies to undertake assigned tasks.
  • Communicate with client representatives on a day-to-day basis, to plan work, keep them informed of progress, resolve any issues of concern and identify variations or additional work required.
  • Identify and drive cost savings and safety improvement initiatives and report on lessons learned and completion/outcomes to the business.

What you will bring
  • Site based experience in the Oil and Gas industry (highly regarded).
  • High Risk Work license: crane (CO highly regarded), Intermediate Rigging and Scaffolding.
  • Demonstrable experience in a supervisory role within the resources or construction sector.
  • Proven leadership skills, with the ability to motivate others.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Proven track record of maintaining a safe working environment.
  • Proof of right to work in Australia.

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the Gladstone community for over 40 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources, Mineral processing, and Energy sector.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Operations Manager - Heavy Lift
description_html:
We have an opportunity for an Operations Manager to join our Engineering Construction (EC) team based in our Victoria Park office. You will be responsible for the management of a key component of our Heavy Lift Business Unit providing crane services to both internal and external clients.
The role encompasses people leadership, crane fleet management, planning & mobilisation, delivery in the field, commercial and financial responsibilities.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Opportunity to step into a key leadership role within the EC team, mentoring teams to deliver exceptional results and drive our high-performance culture
  • Play a central role in shaping the future of EC Heavy Lift by contributing to the Business Unit’s operational strategy
  • Strong exposure to executive-level decision-making and business planning

Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead from the front in promoting a culture of continuous improvement, team development, and a strong safety culture, ensuring compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, policies, guidelines, and quality standards across all sites and workshops.
  • Drive excellence in operational safety performance, implementing initiatives to improve safety outcomes and reinforce a culture of accountability and compliance.
  • Demonstrate excellence in personal interaction, employee engagement, employee relations, and teamwork. Lead effective management of talent including performance management, training, career development, and succession planning.
  • Manage people and operations to deliver exceptional service across a large operational division supporting EC as well as our Maintenance and Industrial Services Division with regular travel to operational sites across Australia.
  • Manage and negotiate with suppliers, OEMs, and external service providers to ensure fit for purpose support, best value outcomes, and strong ongoing commercial relationships.
  • Develop, manage, and control budgets, capital investment business cases, and overall financial performance, implementing initiatives to improve cost effectiveness and achieve agreed financial targets.
  • Enhance and expand the business by identifying, contributing to, and taking advantage of new business development opportunities, while fostering strong relationships with customers and contractors to ensure contract requirements are met.
  • Maintain subject matter expertise in Heavy Lift and Asset Management by staying current with industry trends and developments, attending industry conferences and events, inspecting OEM facilities and equipment, and undertaking domestic and international travel as required.
  • Coordinate and drive fleet strategy and associated initiatives, including delivery and support of new and leased plant and equipment, proactive and planned maintenance, KPI reporting, and continuous improvement of maintenance systems to maximise fleet availability, utilisation, and efficiency.

What you’ll bring:
  • Engineering Degree or Trade qualification (relevant trade) with significant demonstrated experience in the management of teams in a large organisation.
  • Knowledge of crane operations and industrial services in the resources sector with the ability to manage multiple external customers. You will understand the constraints of working in live operating environments across Mining and Oil & Gas.
  • Strong people leadership skills across all levels of the organisation including field-based teams.
  • Ability to effectively communicate at a senior management level within our organisation and that of our customer's and external stakeholders.
  • Extensive experience managing internal stakeholders and providing internally focused services.
  • Strong understanding in commercial management, budgets, forecasting and change management, with a focus on driving sustainable operations.
  • Ability to manage risk as applied to sites including HSE, quality, communication, organisational and site/project-specific challenges (schedule, budget, etc) risk.

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Engineering Construction division is an increasingly diverse business, focusing on managing and delivering large-scale project management and construction services. Our expertise includes civil construction, structural steel fabrication, modularisation and delivery, as well as structural, mechanical, piping and tank construction. We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: BMWs, Riggers/Scaffs, Elecs, Painter/Blasters, Mech Techs & Rope Access
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently recruiting Boilermakers / Welders, Riggers / Scaffolders, Electricians, Painter / Blasters, Mechanical Fitters and Rope Access Technicians to join our ongoing rostered maintenance, shutdown and projects teams across the Pilbara. With Perth and Karratha point of hire, these roles offer a variety of rolling shutdown swings, ongoing maintenance and project-based rosters across a range of sites.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division is known for top-quality work in mining maintenance, shutdowns, and sustaining capital works. We’ve earned strong, long-lasting relationships with industry leaders because we focus on getting the job done right, safely, and efficiently.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include;

  • Rolling shutdown swings, ongoing maintenance and project-based rosters across a range of sites for blue chip iron ore Customers
  • Diverse and Challenging Work: Get involved in exciting shutdowns, maintenance and projects across the Pilbara, including Karratha, Tom Price and Paraburdoo
  • Safety and Wellbeing: Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way
  • Team Culture: Join a supportive, collaborative team. We’re all about being solution-focused, reliable, and supporting one another with a positive, can-do attitude
  • Growth & Loyalty: We’ll help you reach your potential, providing the support you need to grow and succeed.


What you will bring:

  • Experience in iron ore mining or equivalent
  • Australian recognised Trade Certificate (as applicable to your role)
  • Working at Heights (valid within 3 years) (as applicable to your role)
  • Enter and Work in Confined Space (valid within 3 years) (as applicable to your role)
  • Basic Fire (Valid within 4 years) (as applicable to your role)
  • High Risk Work Licence (as applicable to your role)
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • White Card
  • Rio Tinto inducted (highly desirable)
  • Proof of right to work in Australia


Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the local community for over 35 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in civil, structural, mechanical and electrical capital projects, maintenance and industrial services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Scheduler
description_html:
We are seeking an experienced Scheduler to support the planning and execution of CHPP major shutdowns and ongoing BAU maintenance activities. 

This role is offered as a minimum 6 month contract, with strong potential for extension based on project requirements.  Roster is flexible 4/3 or 9day fortnight.

This is a great opportunity to step into a key role supporting major shutdown activities within a well established operation. You’ll work with a collaborative team and contribute to critical maintenance outcomes.


Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Opportunity for growth and career opportunities.
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture.


Key responsibilities will include:

  • Develop, coordinate, and maintain detailed schedules for CHPP major shutdowns and routine maintenance activities.
  • Work closely with operations, maintenance, and project teams to ensure effective planning and resource allocation.
  • Provide scheduling support throughout the project lifecycle, including planning, execution, and close out phases.
  • Develop and update the shutdown and major maintenance schedules in accordance with the project requirements.
  • Assist with the set-up and management of the project costs, budgets, claims and forecasts.


What you will bring:

  • Demonstrated experience in planning and scheduling CHPP major shutdowns and maintenance.
  • Shutdown and Dragline experience highly desirable.
  • SAP experience highly preferred.
  • Exposure to all facets of maintenance, planning, and scheduling activities.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strong time management skills and demonstrable experience achieving tight deadlines
  • Proven track record of maintaining a safe working environment
  • Proof of right to work in Australia


Life at Monadelphous

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application. 

About Us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

We have been part of the local Mackay community for over 25 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources and Mining sector.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way.

Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Branch Administrator
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking an experienced Office Administrator to join our Mackay Operations Team.

This is a local role which will see you working in the office Monday – Friday.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Permanent full-time position
  • Office based role
  • Be home every night while living and working locally.
  • Opportunity for growth and career development
Key responsibilities include:
  • Managing weekly Invoicing & Client Claims
  • Procurement - Raising & Managing Purchase Orders
  • Credit card reconciliation
  • Preparation of daily timesheet entry and weekly payroll for up to 40+ employees
  • Provide high quality administrative support to the site manager and operations project team
  • Travel bookings as required
  • General office support duties
What you will bring
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in an office administration role preferred 
  • Site/Project based administrative experience highly regarded
  • Confident and capable user of MS Office Suite
  • Willingness to learn new systems and processes
  • Strong communication skills with all levels of the organisation 
  • Strong attention to detail, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • A focus on providing outstanding customer service.
  • Work cooperatively with others to accomplish project/site goals
  • A positive attitude and dedication to ongoing professional development
  • Proof of right to work in Australia.

title: Graduate Engineer
description_html:
Join the Monadelphous Graduate Program and embark on a dynamic two-year journey to launch your engineering career. As a Graduate, you'll work on real projects, gaining hands-on experience in a Project Engineer role. You’ll work both on-site and in the office between projects, collaborating closely with your team to gain hands-on experience in project delivery and management.

You will assist with project delivery and provide technical and administrative support across the Rail Division.

 As a Graduate, you will have:

  • Opportunity to work on-site, gaining practical experience in project engineering.
  • Ongoing support from a Project Manager, Supervisor, and Graduate buddy.
  • Receive ongoing development through structured Learning & Development modules, workshops, and courses.
  • Benefit from regular catch-ups with the Graduate Team and the chance to network with peers at our annual Graduate Forum.
  • Develop leadership skills and contribute to real-world projects that drive innovation within the industry.
  • The opportunity to participate in a formal Graduate Mentoring Program.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist in preparing and responding to Tenders and RFQs.
  • Coordinate and organise project activities to meet deadlines and deliverables.
  • Support procurement processes, including supplier engagement and material sourcing.
  • Develop and maintain Inspection and Test Plans (ITPs) for compliance.
  • Manage Requests for Information (RFIs) and clarify variations.
  • Oversee Quality Assurance processes, including document control and compliance checks.
  • Provide technical and administrative support to the Project Engineer, Rail Superintendent, and site supervisors.

 

Qualifications & Skills:

  • Degree in Civil Engineering or Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent).
  • Strong organisational and communication skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment.
  • Basic understanding of rail infrastructure projects (preferred but not essential).
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and willingness to learn project management tools.


Why Join Us?

  • Gain hands-on experience across multiple disciplines, including Rail, Civil, Bridge, NPI (Non-Processing Infrastructure), Electrical, and Facility Maintenance.
  • Join a team that prides itself on its culture and values, earning the respect and trust of our clients through professionalism and collaboration.
  • Take advantage of career development opportunities within one of Australia’s leading engineering businesses, offering exposure to major projects and industry best practices.


About us

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Senior Project Engineer
description_html:
Monadelphous are seeking an experienced Senior Project Engineer to join our Maintenance and Industrial Services division, based in our Brisbane Head office Monday to Friday, on a permanent basis. Periodically you will be required to travel to site for short visits.

This high paced position will provide technical expertise across project management, estimating, procurement, contractual correspondence, quality assurance, and internal/external stakeholder management for a program of works.

Key responsibilities include:
  • Work closely with the Site Manager and Project Manager to ensure project objectives are met on time with respect to cost, safety and quality
  • Work closely with client representatives and deliver to meet their requirements
  • Manage the interface between the engineering and project delivery teams to maintain compliance with the specifications, schedules and contract
  • Manage and supervise the resolution of technical queries as required
  • Provide leadership, coaching and mentoring to other members of the engineering team
  • Compile schedule, cost, progress and forecast reports for the project; ensuring all schedule reporting requirements are met
  • Provide support to the project team and implement best practice on the project

What you will bring
  • 5+ years' experience working in an on-site engineering position for large-scale resources construction/maintenance projects
  • Experience building strong, value driven client relationships
  • An Australian recognised, tertiary qualification in Engineering
  • Proven experience in project management, including design management
  • Strong written and technical skills, with an innovative approach to technical problem-solving and continuous improvement
  • Experience of managing the contractual correspondence across project delivery
  • Front end estimating experience working within a bid or tender team for both shutdown and project work
  • Well-developed communication skills and a collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • A strong commitment to maintaining a safe working environment
  • Proof of right to work in Australia and a valid passport

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About Us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been operating in Papua New Guinea over 18 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in structural, mechanical, piping, electrical, civil, and other large-scale services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Senior IR Advisor
description_html:
The role of Senior Industrial Relations Advisor will see you working in Victoria Park and responsible for providing Monadelphous leadership with expert advice, support, and practical solutions across our diverse business divisions.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work on some of the world’s biggest resources, energy, and infrastructure projects
  • Our culture. We are solution focused, reliable and embrace a can-do team environment.
  • Our loyalty. We want you to reach your potential, we would like to help you get there
Key Responsibilities:
  • Provide IR/ER advice and support across multiple divisions
  • Develop and support negotiation and enterprise bargaining strategies and tactics
  • Review, interpret, and apply industrial instruments and relevant legislation
  • Design and implement ER/IR management plans, initiatives, projects, and internal systems, policies, and procedures
  • Travel to remote sites as required to support in-person interventions and stakeholder engagement
What you’ll bring:
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management, Industrial Relations, or a related discipline (highly regarded)
  • Demonstrated experience in employee relations, industrial relations, and/or human resource management within an engineering, construction, resources or heavy industry environment is highly advantageous
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to build effective cross-disciplinary relationships
  • The ability to stay current with IR/ER legislation and best practice and apply this knowledge pragmatically within a complex, multifaceted business
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our corporate offices in Perth and Brisbane enable a wide range of professionals who provide the administration support and corporate services for the teams across Australia and internationally. Join a collaborative and fun team who are contributing to the success of our business every day.



Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

The Safe Way is the Only Way
. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Procurement Officer
description_html:
Monadelphous are seeking a highly motivated Procurement Officer to join our PNG Operations team on a full-time basis. 

This role will be based in the Brisbane Office Monday to Friday, with the occasional requirement for site visits to Papua New Guinea.
 
Key responsibilities include
  • Liaising with a wide range of suppliers and external service providers in relation to hiring, purchasing, invoicing and other procurement / subcontract administration activities
  • Expediting supplier lead times, documentation and logistics
  • Document control with regards to vendor documentation
  • Working closely with the Project Manager and project team both on and off-site regarding procurement
  • Raising purchase orders, variations, credit requests and receipting of goods
  • Ensuring compliance with policies and procedures across the project
  • Organising information into procurement databases and producing reports
  • Flexibility to support additional areas, such as project document control

What you will bring
  • 2+ years’ experience working in a procurement position in the construction or resources sector
  • Demonstrable experience using MS Office Suite and operating document control systems
  • High attention to detail and accuracy in work produced
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent time management skills and demonstrable experience achieving tight deadlines
  • Proven ability to work as a team player, eagerness to learn new systems and work in dynamic environments
  • Proof of right to work in Australia and a valid passport

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About Us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been operating in Papua New Guinea over 18 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in structural, mechanical, piping, electrical, civil, and other large-scale services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Safety Advisor
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking a highly motivated Safety Advisor to support upcoming works in the Latrobe Valley, Victoria.

If you are an experienced and driven Safety Advisor, who wants to be a part of key growth across the renewables sector, come and join the inclusive and high performing team. You'll be contributing to a safety-first culture in a dynamic and rewarding environment.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Site uplift payable on hours worked.
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture.
  • Be part of a supportive and collaborative team.

Key Responsibilities include:
  • Supporting and coaching project personnel to successfully execute major construction projects in a challenging landscape.
  • Onboard major delivery subcontractors and ensure compliance with site safety rules and Company requirements.
  • Monitor subcontractor activities to ensure project safety, environment and technical specifications are adhered to.
  • Supporting Principal Contractor safety obligations onsite and identify any non-compliances.
  • Ensure consistent and high-quality project documentation including management plans, SWMS, risk registers, investigations.
  • Supporting the delivery of HSE advice and services to the project, building effective partnerships with both client and subcontractor HSE teams, and providing hands on support where required.
  • Reporting to the HSE Manager, delivery, and corporate teams to ensure effective functionality and support to operations including behavioural safety and culture improvement campaigns.

What you will bring
  • Australian recognised tertiary qualifications in Occupational Health & Safety.
  • 3+ years' experience in similar HSE site-based roles within the renewables, infrastructure or construction sector.
  • Incident investigation & Return to Work Coordinator experience.
  • Well established knowledge of HSE legislation and industry standards with an in-depth knowledge of Principal Contractor duties.
  • Formal training in incident investigation methodology (ICAM).
  • Intermediate user of MS Office Suite to accurately assemble, maintain and document quality records and accurate reports.
  • Demonstrated proactive attitude toward HSE and procedural compliance.
  • Well-developed written communication skills.
  • Well versed in modern behavioural safety and culture-based programs.
  • Drivers Licence and proof of right to work in Australia.


Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.
