title: Expressions of Interest - Mechanical Engineering Graduate Program Aug26/Feb27
description_html:
Join the Monadelphous Graduate Program and embark on a dynamic two-year journey to launch your engineering career. As a Graduate, you'll work on real projects, gaining hands-on experience in a Project Engineer role. You’ll work both on-site and in the office between projects, collaborating closely with your team to gain hands-on experience in project delivery and management.


Regardless of your engineering discipline whether Electrical, Civil, Mechanical, or other you’ll gain valuable exposure to all areas of project engineering. You’ll work on large-scale projects that integrate multiple disciplines, giving you insight into how each one contributes to the overall success. This hands-on experience will help you develop a comprehensive understanding of project engineering within the resources sector.  


Joining our Graduate Program offers you a unique opportunity to fast-track your career with hands-on experience and strong support. As a Graduate, you will have:

  • Opportunity to work on-site, gaining practical experience in project engineering.
  • Ongoing support from a Project Manager, Supervisor, and Graduate buddy.
  • Receive ongoing development through structured Learning & Development modules, workshops, and courses.
  • Benefit from regular catch-ups with the Graduate Team and the chance to network with peers at our annual Graduate Forum.
  • Develop leadership skills and contribute to real-world projects that drive innovation within the industry.
  • The opportunity to participate in a formal Graduate Mentoring Program.
  • Rotations through various business areas, to broaden your skills and explore different career paths regardless of whether your background is in Engineering or Construction Management.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Work with the Project Manager to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet safety and quality standards.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, subcontractors, and internal teams.
  • Manage sub-contractors across various disciplines to ensure alignment with project goals.
  • Assist in preparing project estimates, tender submissions, and developing project schedules.
  • Support all phases of the project lifecycle, including tendering, planning, execution, and HSE compliance.
  • Collaborate with the Operational team to ensure a team-oriented approach to project delivery.
  • Manage project scope, schedule, and budgets as required, ensuring effective execution.

What you’ll bring:


  • Australian or New Zealand Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency or suitable Visa with working rights.
  • An Engineering degree (Bachelor or higher) within Electrical and/or Electrical & Instrumentation with previous work experience through vacation work or similar, in Australia or New Zealand.
  • Ability to work on a FIFO or DIDO from Perth, Brisbane or Newcastle
  • Previous work experience within your chosen field through internships or equivalent is highly desirable.
  • A passion for the work we do and the desire to do real hands-on work in the field


Life at Monadelphous 


There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.


About us


Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

As a Monadelphous Graduate, you will have the opportunity to gain experience across our two key Operational Divisions: Engineering Construction (EC) and Maintenance & Industrial Services (M&IS).

  • In the EC Division, you’ll be involved in large-scale projects spanning civil construction, structural steel fabrication, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.
  • In the M&IS Division, you’ll contribute to a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.


Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Expressions of Interest - Construction Management Graduate Program Aug26/Feb27
description_html:
Join the Monadelphous Graduate Program and embark on a dynamic two-year journey to launch your engineering career. As a Graduate, you'll work on real projects, gaining hands-on experience in a Project Engineer role. You’ll work both on-site and in the office between projects, collaborating closely with your team to gain hands-on experience in project delivery and management.

Joining our Graduate Program offers you a unique opportunity to fast-track your career with hands-on experience and strong support. As a Graduate, you will have:

  • Opportunity to work on-site, gaining practical experience in project engineering.
  • Ongoing support from a Project Manager, Supervisor, and Graduate buddy.
  • Receive ongoing development through structured Learning & Development modules, workshops, and courses.
  • Benefit from regular catch-ups with the Graduate Team and the chance to network with peers at our annual Graduate Forum.
  • Develop leadership skills and contribute to real-world projects that drive innovation within the industry.
  • The opportunity to participate in a formal Graduate Mentoring Program.
  • Rotations through various business areas, to broaden your skills and explore different career paths within the company.

Key Responsibilities:


  • Work with the Project Manager to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet safety and quality standards.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, subcontractors, and internal teams.
  • Manage sub-contractors across various disciplines to ensure alignment with project goals.
  • Assist in preparing project estimates, tender submissions, and developing project schedules.
  • Support all phases of the project lifecycle, including tendering, planning, execution, and HSE compliance.
  • Collaborate with the Operational team to ensure a team-oriented approach to project delivery.
  • Manage project scope, schedule, and budgets as required, ensuring effective execution.

What you’ll bring:


  • Australian or New Zealand Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency or suitable Visa with working rights.
  •  Must be studying or have completed an Undergraduate Degree (Bachelor’s) in Australia or New Zealand
  • A Construction Management or Engineering degree (Bachelor or higher) within the following disciplines: Mechanical, Civil & Structural, Mechatronic, Chemical, Electrical and Electrical & Instrumentation with previous work experience through vacation work or similar
  • Ability to work on a FIFO or DIDO from Perth, Brisbane or Newcastle
  • Previous work experience within your chosen field through internships or equivalent is highly desirable.
  • A passion for the work we do and the desire to do real hands-on work in the field


Life at Monadelphous 


There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.


About us


Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

As a Monadelphous Graduate, you will have the opportunity to gain experience across our two key Operational Divisions: Engineering Construction (EC) and Maintenance & Industrial Services (M&IS).

  • In the EC Division, you’ll be involved in large-scale projects spanning civil construction, structural steel fabrication, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.
  • In the M&IS Division, you’ll contribute to a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

You will also have the opportunity to explore a broad range of industries and business units, regardless of whether your background is in Engineering or Construction Management.

  • Work across diverse business units, including Energy, Heavy Lift, Inteforge, iPipe, and BMC.
  • Gain hands-on experience in key sectors like resources, energy, infrastructure, and mining.
  • Develop into a well-rounded Project Engineer through a structured program that supports leadership, innovation, and growth.
  • Be exposed to different career pathways within our dynamic business, with plenty of opportunities to grow and explore within our dynamic business.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Expressions of Interest - Contracts Graduate Program Aug26/Feb27
description_html:
Our Graduate Program – Commercial & Contracts is a dynamic two-year journey designed to accelerate your professional development and provide you with real-world experience. Throughout the program, you will gain exposure to various business areas and the chance to rotate across different functions to broaden your skills.

As a Graduate, you will have:

  • Ongoing support from a Divisional Contracts Manager and Graduate buddy.
  • Receive ongoing development through structured Learning & Development modules, workshops, and courses.
  • Benefit from regular catch-ups with the Graduate Team and the chance to network with peers at our annual Graduate Forum.
  • Develop leadership skills and contribute to real-world projects that drive innovation within the industry.
  • Rotations through various business areas, to broaden your skills and explore different career paths within the company.

Through completion of the program, graduates will:

  • Understand the scope and commercial responsibilities of the Contracts function.
  • Learn to interpret and apply head contract and subcontract terms.
  • Understand and contribute to the procurement and subcontracting process.
  • Support and manage subcontractor performance and compliance.
  • Learn to identify, assess and administer variations and claims.
  • Understand cost control, payment processes and commercial reporting.
  • Build professional communication and negotiation skills.

What you’ll bring:

  • Australian or New Zealand Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency.
  • Must be studying or have completed an Undergraduate Degree (Bachelor’s) in Australia within the following areas: Business, Commerce, Law or Construction Management.
  • Previous work experience within your chosen field through internships or equivalent is highly desirable.
  • A passion for the work we do and the desire to gain hands-on experience.

Life at Monadelphous:

There’s lots to get involved in, from celebratory or cultural events to exciting career opportunities. We are committed to making Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We strongly encourage people from all diverse backgrounds, including women and First Nations people, to apply.

About Us:

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance, and industrial services to major companies in the resources, energy, and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and globally for over 50 years. Our projects are some of the biggest in the industry, and we offer a variety of career opportunities within our key operational divisions: Engineering Construction (EC) and Maintenance & Industrial Services (M&IS).

Whether in large-scale engineering projects or ongoing maintenance services, we ensure our teams have the opportunity to follow their career paths in a dynamic and growing business.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Expressions of Interest - Accounting Graduate Program Aug26/Feb27
description_html:
As a Graduate Accountant, you will join our Graduate Program, a dynamic three-year journey designed to accelerate your professional development and provide you with real-world experience in both project accounting and management accounting roles. Throughout the program, you will have the opportunity to pursue a professional qualification with CA or CPA, gaining exposure to various business areas and the chance to rotate across different functions to broaden your skills.


As a Graduate, you will have:

  • Ongoing support from a Commercial Manager and Graduate buddy.
  • Opportunity to gain either a CA or CPA qualification.
  • Receive ongoing development through structured Learning & Development modules, workshops, and courses.
  • Benefit from regular catch-ups with the Graduate Team and the chance to network with peers at our annual Graduate Forum.
  • Develop leadership skills and contribute to real-world projects that drive innovation within the industry.
  • Rotations through various business areas, to broaden your skills and explore different career paths within the company.

Key Responsibilities:


  • Manage project costs, forecasting, and financial controls across multiple projects.
  • Collaborate with Project Managers to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget.
  • Assist in management reporting, financial analysis, and project-related documentation.
  • Support budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis for projects.
  • Provide financial insights and recommendations for project performance.
  • Build strong relationships with internal teams, clients, and stakeholders for effective project financial management.
  • Contribute to monthly financial reporting and business performance analysis

What you’ll bring:


  • Australian or New Zealand Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency.
  • Must be studying or have completed an Undergraduate Accountancy Degree (Bachelor’s) in Australia.
  • Previous work experience within your chosen field through internships or equivalent is highly desirable.
  • A passion for the work we do and the desire to gain hands-on experience in both project and management accounting.

Life at Monadelphous


There’s lots to get involved in, from celebratory or cultural events to exciting career opportunities. We are committed to making Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

title: Expressions of Interest - Engineering Winter Internship Aug 26
description_html:
Joining the Monadelphous Winter Internship is the start of something much bigger than just your future; we believe you could change the future of the industry and we genuinely believe that gaining work experience as part of your studies is a crucial first step. Embark on a dynamic 5-week journey to launch your engineering career. As an undergraduate, you'll work on real projects, gaining hands-on experience in Project Engineering.

Our Winter Internship offers you a unique opportunity to fast-track your career with hands-on experience and strong support. As an undergraduate, you will have:

  • Opportunity to work on-site, gaining practical experience in project engineering.
  • Ongoing support from a Project Manager, Supervisor, and Graduate buddy.

  • Work within a diverse operations team to successfully deliver project scopes.
  • Assist with the planning, coordination, and execution of project tasks, supporting Project engineers and project managers.
  • Contribute to project documentation, reporting, and quality control processes.
  • Participate in inspections, ensuring compliance with safety and project standards.


What you’ll bring:


  • Australian or New Zealand Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency or suitable Visa with working rights.

title: Expressions of Interest - Contracts Summer Vacation Program Feb 27
description_html:
Joining the Monadelphous Summer Vacation Program is the start of something much bigger than just your future; we believe you could change the future of the industry and we genuinely believe that gaining work experience as part of your studies is a crucial first step. Embark on a dynamic 12-week journey to launch your career. As an undergraduate, you'll work on real projects, gaining hands-on experience in Commercials & Contracts.

Our Summer Vacation Program offers you a unique opportunity to fast-track your career with hands-on experience and strong support. As an undergraduate, you will have:

  • Opportunity to work gaining practical experience.
  • Ongoing support from a Divisional Contracts Manager and Graduate buddy.
  • Benefit from regular catch-ups with the Graduate Team and the chance to network with peers.
  • Develop leadership skills and contribute to real-world projects that drive innovation within the industry.


Key responsibilities could include:

  • Understanding the scope and commercial responsibilities of the Contracts function.
  • Learning to interpret and apply head contract and subcontract terms.
  • Contributing to the procurement and subcontracting process.
  • Assist in supporting and managing subcontractor performance and compliance.
  • Learn to identify, assess and administer variations and claims.
  • Understand cost control, payment processes and commercial reporting.
  • Build professional communication and negotiation skills.


What you’ll bring:

  • Australian or New Zealand Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency.
  • Must be studying or have completed an Undergraduate Degree (Bachelor’s) in Australia within the following areas: Business, Commerce, Law or Construction Management.
  • Previous work experience within your chosen field through internships or equivalent is highly desirable.
  • A passion for the work we do and the desire to gain hands-on experience.

title: Senior Functional Analyst
description_html:
The role of Senior Functional Analyst will see you working closely with the recruitment, HR and L&D functions to analyse, design and implement solutions that support our talent acquisition and talent management needs. You will be instrumental in ensuring our HR systems and processes are efficient, effective, compliant and aligned with business needs, with regular engagement with the vendor (Avature) and IT.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work on some of the world’s biggest resources, energy and infrastructure projects.
  • Our culture. We’re solution focused, reliable and embrace a ‘can-do’ team environment.
  • Our loyalty. We want you to reach your potential, we’d like to help you get there.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Gather business requirements from internal stakeholders, translate requirements into functional specifications, conduct gap analysis between current and future states, recommend process improvements and system enhancements.
  • Regular and ongoing vendor engagement with Avature to explore assumptions, solutions and constraints.
  • Implement improvements to system including data sets, workflows, reports and portals.
  • Testing and quality assurance, ensuring solutions meet business needs before go-live.
  • Post-implementation support, troubleshooting issues, recording feedback, and identifying opportunities for continuous improvement.
  • Create and maintain training materials and delivering user training to internal stakeholders to drive adoption.
  • Maintain system configuration including data sets, workflows and reports.
What you’ll bring:
  • Previous experience working with Avature highly desired.
  • Demonstrable experience working in process standardisation, optimisation and automation.
  • Experience working with Recruitment, HR and people data at a large organisation.
  • Experience working with SaaS vendors, especially ATS, CRM and BI software.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills and an ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders.
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our corporate offices in Perth and Brisbane enable a wide range of professionals who provide the administration support and corporate services for the teams across Australia and internationally. Join a collaborative and fun team who are contributing to the success of our business every day.



Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: IT Support Officer
description_html:
We are currently looking to fill an IT Support Officer position at our Perth office in Victoria Park, WA.. As an essential part of our Group IT Service Desk team, you will provide Level 1-2 support while working on-site. This role will see you play a pivotal part in ensuring smooth IT operations and delivering high-quality support to our staff.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Permanent full-time position
  • Corporate discounts & company benefits
  • Novated leasing salary packaging
Key Responsibilities:
  • Provide Exceptional IT Support: Assist users with a wide range of IT issues, aiming to deliver a seamless and positive experience.
  • Troubleshooting and Problem-Solving: Actively troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, building valuable skills and knowledge along the way.
  • Effective Communication: Keep clear and concise records of service interactions and communicate effectively with users to ensure understanding.
  • Flexibility: Be willing to work flexible hours and participate in a shift roster to meet the evolving needs of our business.
What you’ll bring:
  • Team Spirit and Communication Skills: A team first mindset with the ability to clearly explain technical information to users at all levels.
  • Passion for IT and Problem-Solving: A genuine interest in technology, a thirst to learn, and enthusiasm for troubleshooting and resolving issues.
  • Foundational IT Skills: Familiarity with Windows 10/11 and Microsoft Office 365, with a willingness to learn more about Microsoft Server, Active Directory, and Group Policy.
  • Adaptability: A flexible approach, ready to take on new challenges and adapt to changing priorities.
Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

title: Special Class Welders
description_html:
We are seeking Special Class Welders with a strong LNG and Construction background to assist with our Pluto Train 1 Modification Project in Karratha. The scope covers the modification of the plant to enable the processing of Scarborough gas and includes the installation and movement of three large modules, the installation and movement of three skids, installation of large bore piping, installation of two compressors. Works will be conducted within a live LNG plant (brownfields environment).

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include: 

 * FIFO from Perth: 2 weeks on, 1 week off, no RDO 
 * Site allowance, Project Completion Bonus on offer. 
 * Opportunity to join our growing construction division and be part of an exciting new project. 
 * Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture 

What you'll bring: 

 * 2 years LNG relevant experience
 * Construction White Card
 * Basic Fire
 * Working at Heights (Within 2 years) 
 * Gas Test Atmosphere 
 * Australian Recognised Trade Certificate
* Valid Driver's Licence
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
 * Proof of right to work in Australia 
* Ability to pass weld tests  Life at Monadelphous

Life at Monadelphous 

There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

title: EEHA Electricians
description_html:
We are seeking Electricians with current EEHA certification to assist with our Pluto Train 1 Modification Project in Karratha. The scope of work is the electrical, instrumentation and commissioning works required for the modification of the plant to enable the processing of Scarborough gas. Works will be conducted within a live LNG plant (brownfields environment).

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • FIFO/DIDO: 2 weeks on, 1 week off, no RDO
  • Site allowance, Project Completion Bonus on offer.
  • Opportunity to join our growing construction division and be part of an exciting new project.
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture

What you’ll bring:
  • 2 years LNG relevant experience
  • Full WA Electrical Licence
  • Certificate IV in Hazardous Areas (EEHA within 2 years)
  • Construction White Card
  • LVR CPR (Within 1 year)
  • Provide First Aid (Within 3 years)
  • Gas Test Atmosphere
  • Valid Driver's License
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

title: SMP Supervisor
description_html:
Monadelphous are seeking an experienced SMP Supervisor to join our PNG Operations team for a 9-month contract commencing February 2026, based on site in Papua New Guinea on a FIFO 3:3 roster. There will be further opportunities to work on other projects following this engagement.


Reporting to the Site Manager, this position will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and supervising daily activities of work crews; ensuring compliance with internal, client, and legislative HSE requirements; and ensuring that the quality, production, and environmental requirements of the project are met.


What you will bring:

  • Australian recognised Mechanical or Fabrication Trade Certificate
  • Demonstrable experience working as an SMP Supervisor within the resources sector
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Proven leadership skills, with the ability to mentor and motivate a national workforce in the field
  • Strong attention to detail and demonstrable experience achieving tight deadlines
  • Proven track record of maintaining a safe working environment
  • Proof of right to work in Australia and a valid passport
  • Experience working in PNG or remote locations (highly regarded)

Life at Monadelphous

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.


About Us

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.


Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.


We have been operating in Papua New Guinea over 18 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in structural, mechanical, piping, electrical, civil, and other large-scale services.


Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours

title: QAQC Coordinator
description_html:
Monadelphous are seeking an experienced QA/QC Coordinator to join our PNG Operations team for a 9-month contract commencing January 2026, based on site in Papua New Guinea on a FIFO 3:3 roster. There will be further opportunities to work on other projects following this engagement.


Reporting to the Site Manager, this position will be responsible for leading the implementation of the Monadelphous Quality Management policy, system, and strategies with a particular focus on quality control on site in PNG.


What you will bring:

  • Australian recognised Trade Certificate
  • Current Weld Australia Welding Supervisor AS1796 certificate 10 and/ or IWS qualification
  • 5+ years’ experience working in a QAQC position within the resources sector
  • Well-developed communication skills and a collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels

title: IT Support Officer
description_html:
We are currently looking to fill an IT Support Officer position at our Milton office in Brisbane. As an essential part of our Group IT Service Desk team, you will provide Level 1-2 support while working on-site. This role will see you play a pivotal part in ensuring smooth IT operations and delivering high-quality support to our staff.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Permanent full-time position
  • Corporate discounts & company benefits
  • Novated leasing salary packaging
Key Responsibilities:
  • Provide Exceptional IT Support: Assist users with a wide range of IT issues, aiming to deliver a seamless and positive experience.
  • Troubleshooting and Problem-Solving: Actively troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, building valuable skills and knowledge along the way.
  • Effective Communication: Keep clear and concise records of service interactions and communicate effectively with users to ensure understanding.
  • Flexibility: Be willing to work flexible hours and participate in a shift roster to meet the evolving needs of our business.
What you’ll bring:
  • Team Spirit and Communication Skills: A team first mindset with the ability to clearly explain technical information to users at all levels.
  • Passion for IT and Problem-Solving: A genuine interest in technology, a thirst to learn, and enthusiasm for troubleshooting and resolving issues.
  • Foundational IT Skills: Familiarity with Windows 10/11 and Microsoft Office 365, with a willingness to learn more about Microsoft Server, Active Directory, and Group Policy.
  • Adaptability: A flexible approach, ready to take on new challenges and adapt to changing priorities.
Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our corporate offices in Perth and Brisbane enable a wide range of professionals who provide the administration support and corporate services for the teams across Australia and internationally. Join a collaborative and fun team who are contributing to the success of our business every day.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: HV Technician/Electrician
description_html:
High Energy Service (HES), a Monadelphous Business, is currently seeking HV Technicians to join our HES Metro team. This team focuses on providing maintenance services to the Perth and surrounding areas.

Working with HES offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Competitive remuneration packages that reward experience and competency
  • HES has a long-term sustainable business model that enables us to offer a full-time position with excellent, long-term job security
  • Extensive internal development and training opportunities allowing you to continually progress your career and capabilities
  • The working roster is flexible, enabling you to take control of your workload
Key Responsibilities:
  • Interpretation of drawings
  • Completion of fault-finding activities
  • Protection relays testing and commissioning
  • HV Switching and writing HV Switching programs
  • Earth System Testing
  • Testing, commissioning, and maintenance of High Voltage assets
  • Safety, Quality and Compliance focus
What you’ll bring:
  • Good knowledge of power systems and high voltage testing principles
  • Collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Well-developed communication skills and ability to mentor others
  • Trade Qualified Electrician
  • HV Switching Ticket
  • Unrestricted WA Drivers Licence
  • Right to work in Australia
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

High Energy Services (HES) is a Monadelphous Business and one of Australia's leading high voltage service providers. Operating from a purpose-built facility in Wangara, we specialise in testing, maintenance, compliance, commissioning, installation and engineering for high voltage assets across mining, utilities and energy.  With a team of more than 100 highly skilled professionals, HES is committed to developing its people and provides opportunities to grow your career while working with industry-leading technology and projects.


Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Mobilisation officer
description_html:
High Energy Service (HES), a Monadelphous Business, is currently seeking a Mobilisation Officer to join our Wangara based team.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Competitive remuneration packages that reward experience and competency
  • HES has a long-term sustainable business model that enables us to offer a full-time position with excellent, long-term job security
  • Extensive internal development and training opportunities allowing you to continually progress your career and capabilities
Key Responsibilities:
  • Coordinate ongoing travel arrangements for white-and-blue-collar employees
  • Facilitate seamless mobilisation and demobilisation, coordinating end to end tasks
  • Managing flight and accommodation queries
  • Work closely with Project Managers and Supervisors
  • Check, manage and update labour lists
  • Update employee, shutdown and project information on applicable databases
  • Coordination io onboarding inductions, training and DAS (Drug & Alcohol) screenings
What you’ll bring:
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in Site Mobilisation Administration
  • Proactive, punctual and reliable team player
  • Strong client liaison skills
  • Proven organisational and time management skills
  • Ability to work within deadlines
  • Strong attention to detail including good verbal and written communication skills

title: Local Gladstone Electrician
description_html:
We are currently seeking an experienced, local and qualified Electrician for a permanent role in Gladstone. The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering maintenance support. Candidates MUST be local to the Gladstone area.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Regular overtime
  • Home every night while living and working locally
  • Immediate start available

What you will bring:

  • Current Electrical Licence
  • LVR/CPR within 12 months
  • Current High-Risk Work Licence (Desired)
  • Working at Heights Ticket (within 2 years)
  • Confined Space (within 2 years)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Valid Australian Driver's Licence
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply.  We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application. 

About us

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Engineering Construction division is an increasingly diverse business, focusing on managing and delivering large-scale project management and construction services. Our expertise includes civil construction, structural steel fabrication, modularisation and delivery, as well as structural, mechanical, piping and tank construction. We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.

We have been part of the Gladstone community for over 40 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources, Mineral processing, and Energy sector

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Painter Blaster
description_html:
We are currently seeking experienced and local Painter Blasters. The successful candidates will be responsible for delivering maintenance and project support to our clients in the Gladstone region. This is a permanent full-time role, with some overtime opportunities. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Permanent, full time positions
  • Opportunity for overtime
  • Home every night while living and working locally

What you will bring:

  • Trade Certification (Desirable)
  • Current High Risk Work License (preference for WP, LF)
  • Working at Heights training preferred  (within 2 years)
  • Confined Space Entry training preferred (within 2 years)
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Local to the Gladstone Region
Some of your key responsibilities would include:
  • Cleaning surfaces prior to and after surface preparation to specification.
  • Mixing paint according to instructions. Selecting and preparing paints to required colours by mixing portions of pigment, oil, and thinning and drying additives.
  • Use of hand tools, such as: paint brushes; rollers; sanding blocks; wallpaper cutters; trimming knives; and fillers and spatulas.
  • Ensure protective coatings are applied using brush, roller and spray equipment. 
  • Applying paints to surfaces using all forms of brushes and roller nap types, using appropriate techniques to minimise drips, runs and brush marks, and to maintain straight edges. 
  • Ensure all finished coatings have been verified and inspected after coating has been completed. 
  • Ensure all coating complies with standards and specifications that meets Industry, Customer and Business system requirements.

title: Business Analyst
description_html:
Working within our Group IT team, you’ll join a collaborative, cohesive team directly contributing to the success of our business every day. 

The role of IT Business Analyst will see you supporting the delivery of digital transformation projects across the company with the opportunity to influence positive change on the company's systems and technology landscape.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Influence positive change on the company's systems and technology landscape.
  • Permanent full-time position
  • Corporate discounts and company benefits
Key Responsibilities:
  • Partner with business stakeholders and technology teams to identify business problems and opportunities and drive consensus on the recommended solutions to address them
  • Identify, map, analyse and document current business processes and recommend future business process and system changes to improve productivity and efficiency to meet business outcomes.
  • Undertake cost benefit analysis and develop compelling business cases which support the delivery of recommended solutions and enhancements.
  • Manage the lifecycle of requirements – elicitation, collaboration, documentation, prioritisation, maintenance, monitoring, assessment, approval and traceability of requirements
  • Document test plans, test cases and manage user acceptance testing in partnership with business SMEs and business stakeholders.
  • Train business SMEs and business stakeholders and assist with organisational change management activities to enhance the adoption of new technologies delivered to meet the business needs.
What you’ll bring:
  • Technology or Business Analysis qualification or equivalent competency.
  • Prior experience (4+ years) in business analysis and/or consulting roles.
  • Ability to understand and translate both business and technical concepts, processes, requirements and solutions.
  • Strong stakeholder and relationship management skills.
  • Analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilities.
  • Excellent communication, documentation and presentation skills.
  • Self-motivated, able to work independently and as part of a team.
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our corporate offices in Perth and Brisbane enable a wide range of professionals who provide the administration support and corporate services for the teams across Australia and internationally. Join a collaborative and fun team who are contributing to the success of our business every day.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: QA/QC Administrator
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking an experienced, local QA/QC Administrator for a permanent role in Gladstone.  Candidates MUST be local to the Gladstone area.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Working with industry leaders.
  • Home every night while living and working locally.
  • Opportunity for growth and career development.
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture.
  • Immediate start available.

Key Responsibilities include:
  • Review, check, and file material certificates and quality records.
  • Assist in reviewing work packs, weld maps, hydro test documents, and MDRs for accuracy and client submission.
  • Maintaining registers, including entering results and saving pressure graphs.
  • Update QA registers, maintain ITP and MDR indexes/templates, and manage QA document changes for consistent reporting.
  • Support audit preparation and ensure compliance with quality management system requirements.

What you will bring:
  • Strong administrative skills with technical and process understanding.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite.
  • 3–5 years’ experience in a similar role within resources, engineering, construction, or maintenance.
  • Knowledge of quality systems, audits, and ISO:9001 application.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proof of right to work in Australia.

Life at Monadelphous

title: Document Controller
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking a Document Controller to join our clients offshore turnaround, commencing in mid-2026.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • 3:3 roster
  • Casual hourly rate + 40% Offshore allowance on all hours worked
  • Short term project (execution will run for approximately 65 days)
  • Be part of a world class FLNG facility
Key Responsibilities:
  • Processing information into the relevant document control systems.
  • Organising, recording and storing information and respond to requests for up to date documentation including drawings and specifications, procedures and policies.
  • Handling enquiries from internal and external parties related to documentation issues.
  • Providing document control system export reporting.
  • Working in accordance with Quality Assurance procedures
What you’ll bring:
  • Previous administrative experience within the resources sector
  • Certificate in Business Administration or related field is desirable
  • Exceptional attention to detail and a sound understanding and ability to apply document control processes
  • Strong computer skills – a strong grasp of the Microsoft Office Suite
  • Ability to work effectively independently and as part of a larger team
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

title: Completions Engineer
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking a Turnaround Engineer to join our clients offshore turnaround, commencing in mid- 2026.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • 3:1 roster for Offshore execution
  • Casual hourly rate + 40% Offshore allowance on all hours worked
  • Short term project (execution will run for approximately 65 days)
  • Be part of a world class FLNG facility
Key Responsibilities:
  • Support and deliver offshore completion activities, ensuring full compliance with procedures and standards
  • Review engineering and completion documentation post-sign-off
  • Manage data and documentation close-out, ensuring all signatures, dates, ITRs, torque values and assurance records meet compliance
  • Verify documentation accuracy and completeness prior to handover and commissioning
  • Oversee safe restart activities and system reinstatement
  • Ensure flange assurance, correct torqueing, and no-leak conditions prior to commissioning
  • Work collaboratively with production, commissioning, and completions teams
  • Provide support during Turnarounds (TARs) and shutdowns
What you’ll bring:
  • Strong offshore completions or pre-commissioning experience
  • Extensive experience with leak testing, flange management and QA/QC processes
  • Production or process engineering background with an understanding of hydrocarbon safety
  • Experience in shutdowns or TAR environments
  • High attention to detail and strong commitment to safe work practices
  • Ability to manage complex documentation and maintain compliance with procedures
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills

Work collaboratively with production, commissioning, and completions teams
Provide support during Turnarounds (TARs) and shutdowns
What you’ll bring:
Strong offshore completions or pre-commissioning experience
Extensive experience with leak testing, flange management and QA/QC processes
Production or process engineering background with an understanding of hydrocarbon safety
Experience in shutdowns or TAR environments
High attention to detail and strong commitment to safe work practices
Ability to manage complex documentation and maintain compliance with procedures
Strong communication and teamwork skills
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application
About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.
Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.
We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.
Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise:
The Safe Way is the Only Way
. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Completions Coordinator
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking a Turnaround Coordinator to join our clients offshore turnaround, commencing in mid- 2026.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • 3:1 roster thru offshore execution
  • Casual hourly rate + 40% Offshore allowance on all hours worked
  • Short term project (execution will run for approximately 65 days plus office based close out)
  • Be part of a world class FLNG facility

Key Responsibilities:

  • Coordinating works between the engineering, maintenance, projects, Shutdown and quality teams to ensure that completions activities are progressively completed as early and efficiently as possible
  • Assisting in the management and development of ITRs
  • Managing data within the Clients Completions Management System
  • Checking handover packages and associated documents to ensure that they contain all the required information
  • Managing the punchlist register.
  • Working collaboratively and efficiently with the client to ensure sign-off is achieved.
  • Tracking and reporting on status of completion activities
  • Issuing of the system MCC (Mechanical Completions Certificate) and other relevant certificates at the completion of the Turnaround

What you’ll bring:

  • 5+ years’ experience similar Oil & Gas Turnaround projects in Australia
  • Ability to communicate effectively with Maintenance on Completions to ensure Systems are handed over;
  • Extensive practical line walks experience and punch list activities reading from P&ID’s
  • Strong written and technical skills

title: 2026 Apprenticeship –                                   Boilermaker/ Welders
description_html:
Monadelphous is looking for boilermaker/welder apprentices to join our Kalgoorlie branch. Successful candidates will commence in January 2026.

During your 4-year apprenticeship, you will work from the Kalgoorlie workshop, combining paid work with practical hands-on training alongside experienced tradespeople. You will receive strong support throughout your apprenticeship, working towards achieving your trade certificate and potential long-term career development. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include: 

  • Obtain a national accredited qualification  
  • Participate in a structured apprenticeship program that combines on the job training with formal education from RTO 
  • Potential to work in various projects across the region, broadening your perspectives  
  • Ongoing support from the apprenticeship team along side with your direct work team, helps to navigate through the program  
  • Opportunity for growth and career progression, clear pathways for advancement 
  • We value workplace safety, and ensure a safe and secure working environment 


Key Responsibilities: 

  • Comply with responsibilities in relation to the terms of the training contract as an apprentice  
  • Complete a qualification in Certificate III in Engineering – Fabrication trade while working a full time capacity  
  • Develop skills under the supervision of different experienced supervisors  
  • Assist in fabrication and interpret drawing  
  • Work effectively both independently and as part of a team 
  • Learn to perform various techniques and meet quality standards  
  • Follow workplace safety procedures and proactively identify and report potential hazards 


What you will bring 

  • Strong interest and commitment to an apprenticeship in your chosen field 
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  
  • Valid driver's licence and/or reliable transportation to and from work 
  • Proof of right to work in Australia  
  • Reside locally in the Kalgoorlie area 
  • Pre-Apprenticeship (Certificate II in Engineering) beneficial but not essential  


Life at Monadelphous  

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.


About us   

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice. 

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services. 

We have been part of the local community for over 50 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in maintenance and shutdown services and repairs and fabrication.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Riggers
description_html:
We are currently seeking experienced and local Riggers.  The successful candidates will be responsible for delivering maintenance and project support to our clients in the Gladstone region.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Permanent & full time positions
  • Opportunity for overtime
  • Home every night while living and working locally

What you will bring:

  • Current High Risk Work License - RI or RA essential
  • Working at Heights training (within 2 years)
  • Confined Space Entry training (within 2 years)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Local to the Gladstone Region
Life at Monadelphous 

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply. We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application. 

About us

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the Gladstone community for over 40 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources, Mineral processing, and Energy sector.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Senior Safety Advisor
description_html:
Zenviron is seeking a highly motivated Senior Safety Advisor to join our team at our Newcastle Head Office. 
This is a predominantly office-based role with occasional travel to project sites across Australia.

If you are an experienced and driven Senior Safety Advisor, who wants to be a part of key growth across the renewables sector, come and join the inclusive and high performing Zenviron team.


Key responsibilities will include:
  • Supporting and coaching project personnel to successfully execute major construction projects in a challenging landscape.
  • Assist with the onboarding of major delivery subcontractors and ensure compliance with site safety rules and company requirements.
  • Monitor subcontractor activities to ensure project safety, environment and technical specifications are adhered to.
  • Supporting Principal Contractor safety obligations onsite whilst identifying any non-compliances through audits.
  • Supporting the delivery of HSE advice and services to the projects across the business, building effective partnerships with both client and subcontractor HSE teams.
  • Reporting through to the Governance & Risk Manager to ensure effective functionality and support to operations including behavioural safety and culture improvement campaigns.

What you will bring:
  • Australian recognised tertiary qualifications in Occupational Health & Safety.
  • 5+ years' experience in similar HSE site-based and/or corporate roles within the renewables, infrastructure or construction sector.
  • Incident investigation & Return to Work Coordinator experience.
  • Well established knowledge of HSE legislation and industry standards with an in-depth knowledge of Principal Contractor duties.
  • Formal training in incident investigation methodology (ICAM).
  • Proficient user of MS Office Suite to accurately assemble, maintain and document quality records and accurate reports.
  • Well-developed written communication skills.
  • Well versed in modern behavioural safety and culture-based programs.
  • Drivers Licence and proof of right to work in Australia.
To be successful in this role you will require well-developed interpersonal skills to assist you in building effective stakeholder relationships both internally and externally, whilst you will demonstrate a team orientated approach to work and commitment to continuous improvement. Through utilising your time management skills you will have the ability to manage multiple aspects of work concurrently, and for this we offer an attractive remuneration package.

We are committed to our philosophy of Empowering People and encourage innovation and creative thinking. We embrace the benefits of employing hardworking people from rich and varied backgrounds, so we encourage applications that contribute to our diverse workplace.

We understand the importance of recognising each and every member of staff, that’s why at Zenviron your talents will be encouraged to make a valued contribution to the project and the organisation.

About Us
Zenviron is a joint venture between Monadelphous and ZEM Energy and is a market leading engineering, procurement and construction services contractor, specialising in the design and construction of large-scale renewable energy projects in Australia

description_html:
Its where our journey started. The team in Kalgoorlie are a family, and Monadelphous are currently looking to grow that family. We have several major projects and maintenance programs ramping up across the Goldfields and are looking for Kalgoorlie Local Int/Adv Scaffolders to join our core crew.

title: Senior Project Engineer  & Project Engineer - Expression of Interest
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking Expressions of Interest from experienced Senior Project Engineers and Project Engineers to support upcoming works in South Australia. This is an excellent opportunity to join a collaborative, safety‑driven organisation, delivering complex projects within the resources sector, with the potential for ongoing employment beyond the initial scope of work.

These positions will initially be office-based, supporting the planning phase prior to site mobilisation:
Planning Phase: Commencing mid-March, Brisbane office, working Monday to Friday.
Execution Phase: Mobilise to site mid-May, working 2/2 roster.


Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture.
  • Supportive team environment.
  • Flights and accomodation provided.

Key Responsibilities include:
  • Lead and coordinate site support functions (Quality, Technical, Planning, Commercial).
  • Assist in developing project plans, budgets, and schedules.
  • Manage project data, reporting, and commercial documentation.
  • Support tender submissions and execution phases.
  • Participate in client and contractor meetings, offering practical solutions.

What you will bring
  • Australian recognised tertiary qualification in Mechanical or Structural Engineering.
  • Experience working in an on-site engineering position, servicing the resources sector.
  • Strong, clear written and technical skills.
  • Motivated and proactive approach, with an eagerness to learn.
  • Confident user of MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel).
  • A strong commitment to maintaining a safe working environment.
  • Proof of right to work in Australia.

title: E&I Technician - Gladstone
description_html:
We are currently seeking an experienced Electrical and Instrumentation (E&I) Technician. In this role you will be responsible for delivering maintenance support to our client on Curtis Island, Gladstone. This role is heavily involved in the maintenance of the plant instrumentation systems. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include: 
  • Relocation assistance on offer for the right candidate
  • Full time position on offer
  • Great work/life balance with a 9-Day fortnight
  • Home every night while living and working locally

title: Site Manager - Expression of Interest
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking Expressions of Interest from experienced Site Managers to support upcoming works in South Australia. This is an excellent opportunity to join a collaborative, safety-driven organisation delivering complex projects within the resources sector.

This position will initially be office-based, supporting the planning phase prior to site mobilisation:
Planning phase: Commencing mid-March, Brisbane office, Monday to Friday.
Execution Phase: Mobilise to site mid-May, 2/2 roster.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture.
  • Supportive team environment.
  • Office based role with occasional site visits.

  • Preparation and management of project budgets, cost control, contracts and scheduling.
  • Planning and leading the overall execution of all project functions.
  • Ensuring project quality is aligned with statutory and client requirements.
  • Fostering and managing customer relationships.

title: Electrical or Renewables Engineer
description_html:
Zenviron have a permanent position available for a highly motivated Electrical Engineer or Renewables Engineer to join the engineering team based in the Newcastle Office.

Reporting to the Delivery Team Leader, you will be responsible for working within the pre-contracts team in assisting with the coordination of commercially effective engineering solutions for large scale Wind Farms and Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) projects.

If you are an Engineer with experience in the design and construction of major electrical infrastructure projects, who wants to be a part of key growth across the renewables sector, come and join the inclusive and high performing Zenviron team.

Key responsibilities will include:
  • Analyse and interpret project requirement documentation such as scope of works, specifications, planning and connection documents.
  • Prepare associated designs, calculations, and drawings.
  • Assist in estimating quantities and selection of equipment based on project requirements and relevant standards.
  • Respond to technical queries and requests for information.
  • Supporting the project design process and related engineering requirements.
  • Co-ordination of engineering activities with project team and related Stakeholders.
  • Maintaining all related records as applied to each project.

What we are looking for:
  • Australian recognised Bachelor of Engineering (Electrical) or Bachelor of Renewable Energy Engineering.
  • Familiarity with large scale renewable energy or power system projects
  • Proven estimating and tendering experience in construction of major electrical infrastructure projects or utility scale HV substation projects.
  • Good attention to detail and the ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and specifications.
  • Good communication (written and verbal) skill.
  • Proof of right to work in Australia.

To be successful in this role you will require well-developed interpersonal skills to enable you to build effective stakeholder relationships both internally and externally, whilst you demonstrate a team orientated approach to work and commitment to continuous improvement. Through utilising your time management skills, you will have the ability to achieve tight deadlines whilst delivering high quality and effective designs, and for this we offer an attractive remuneration package.

About Us
Zenviron is a joint venture between Monadelphous and ZEM Energy and is a market leading engineering, procurement and construction services contractor, specialising in the design and construction of large-scale renewable energy projects in Australia.

We are committed to our philosophy of Empowering People and encourage innovation and creative thinking. We embrace the benefits of employing hardworking people from rich and varied backgrounds, so we encourage applications that contribute to our diverse workplace.

We understand the importance of recognising each and every member of staff, that’s why at Zenviron your talents will be encouraged to make a valued contribution to the project and the organisation.
description_text:
Zenviron have a permanent position available for a highly motivated Electrical Engineer or Renewables Engineer to join the engineering team based in the Newcastle Office.
Reporting to the Delivery Team Leader, you will be responsible for working within the pre-contracts team in assisting with the coordination of commercially effective engineering solutions for large scale Wind Farms and Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) projects.
If you are an Engineer with experience in the design and construction of major electrical infrastructure projects, who wants to be a part of key growth across the renewables sector, come and join the inclusive and high performing Zenviron team.
Key responsibilities will include:
Analyse and interpret project requirement documentation such as scope of works, specifications, planning and connection documents.
Prepare associated designs, calculations, and drawings.
Assist in estimating quantities and selection of equipment based on project requirements and relevant standards.
Respond to technical queries and requests for information.
Supporting the project design process and related engineering requirements.
Co-ordination of engineering activities with project team and related Stakeholders.
Maintaining all related records as applied to each project.
What we are looking for:
Australian recognised Bachelor of Engineering (Electrical) or Bachelor of Renewable Energy Engineering.
Familiarity with large scale renewable energy or power system projects
Proven estimating and tendering experience in construction of major electrical infrastructure projects or utility scale HV substation projects.
Good attention to detail and the ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and specifications.
Good communication (written and verbal) skill.
Proof of right to work in Australia.
To be successful in this role you will require well-developed interpersonal skills to enable you to build effective stakeholder relationships both internally and externally, whilst you demonstrate a team orientated approach to work and commitment to continuous improvement. Through utilising your time management skills, you will have the ability to achieve tight deadlines whilst delivering high quality and effective designs, and for this we offer an attractive remuneration package.

title: Level 3 Rope Access Technician
description_html:
We’re currently seeking expressions of interest from experienced IRATA Level 3 Rope Access Technicians to join our Onshore Energy team in Darwin, supporting our existing maintenance team. This role will be working on a world class LNG facility and be responsible for executing maintenance work safely and efficiently. If you are a Level 3 IRATA certified Rope Access Technician who is a qualified Mechanical Technician, Dual Trade Instrument Electrician, or Rigger and live locally in Darwin we want to hear from you!

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Permanent ongoing work
  • Lifestyle friendly 9-day fortnight
  • 4 weeks annual leave, plus additional 10 extra lifestyle leave days
  • Lifestyle allowance – additional $5.00 per hour worked on the ILNG facility
  • Overtime rates and allowances, where applicable
  • Career development and clear pathways to progress to higher classifications
  • Salary sacrifice and novated leasing available
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture
  • Discounted health insurance

Our commitment at Monadelphous

There's lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We're committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply. We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About us

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we've been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.
