title: Workshop Technician
description_html:
High Energy Service (HES), a Monadelphous Business, is currently seeking a Workshop Technician to join our team based in Wangara.

Working with HES offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Competitive remuneration packages that reward experience and competency
  • HES has a long-term sustainable business model that enables us to offer a full-time position with excellent, long-term job security
  • Extensive internal development and training opportunities allowing you to continually progress your career and capabilities
  • The working roster is flexible, enabling you to take control of your workload

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for repairs and maintenance of switchgear and HV equipment
  • Transformer maintenance including testing, repairs and streamlining
  • Responsible for maintaining company plant, equipment, and vehicles, including the preparation of their monthly reports and testing
  • Preparation of service reports and QA test sheets
  • Run morning prestart and assign works to align with company timelines
  • Ability to guide and mentor apprentices
  • Safety, Quality and Compliance focus

What you’ll bring:

  • Prior experience in a High Voltage environment
  • Experience with HV switchgear and transformer oil processing and handling
  • Knowledge of HV switchgear and transformer parts and components
  • Previous experience working with all Australian and international standards within the electrical industry
  • Collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Well-developed communication skills and ability to mentor others
  • Basic skills in Microsoft Office including Word and Excel
  • Trade Qualified Electrician
  • HV Switching Ticket
  • Unrestricted WA Drivers Licence
  • Right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

High Energy Services (HES) is a Monadelphous Business and one of Australia's leading high voltage service providers. Operating from a purpose-built facility in Wangara, we specialise in testing, maintenance, compliance, commissioning, installation and engineering for high voltage assets across mining, utilities and energy.  With a team of more than 100 highly skilled professionals, HES is committed to developing its people and provides opportunities to grow your career while working with industry-leading technology and projects.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: HV Technician/Electrician
description_html:
High Energy Service (HES), a Monadelphous Business, is currently seeking HV Technicians/Electricians to join our Resources team. The HES Resources team, provide shutdown services to the resource sector within the Pilbara and surrounding areas, as well many other mining, oil and gas and infrastructure customers across the whole of WA.

Working with HES offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Competitive remuneration packages that reward experience and competency
  • HES has a long-term sustainable business model that enables us to offer a full-time position with excellent, long-term job security
  • Extensive internal development and training opportunities allowing you to continually progress your career and capabilities
  • The working roster is flexible, enabling you to take control of your workload

Key Responsibilities:

  • Well-developed communication skills and ability to liaise with customers
  • Ability to mentor Apprentices
  • Interpretation of drawings
  • Completion of fault-finding activities
  • HV/LV Switchgear Testing
  • Transformer Testing
  • Earth System Testing
  • Motor Testing
  • Thermographic Surveys
  • Testing, commissioning, and maintenance of High Voltage assets
  • Safety, Quality and Compliance focus

What you’ll bring:

  • Prior experience or willingness to learn HV/LV Maintenance and Testing
  • Experience working in a FIFO mining environment (shutdowns experience advantageous)
  • Commissioning experience (preferred)
  • Collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Strong computer literacy
  • Trade Qualified Electrician
  • Unrestricted WA Drivers Licence

title: Calibration Technician
description_html:
High Energy Service (HES), a Monadelphous Business, is currently seeking Calibration Technicians to join our Resources team. The HES Resources team, provide maintenance and shutdown services to the resource sector within the Pilbara and surrounding areas, as well many other mining, oil and gas and infrastructure customers across the whole of WA.

Working with HES offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Competitive remuneration packages that reward experience and competency
  • HES has a long-term sustainable business model that enables us to offer a full-time position with excellent, long-term job security
  • Extensive internal development and training opportunities allowing you to continually progress your career and capabilities
  • The working roster is flexible, enabling you to take control of your workload

Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform calibration and testing activities within the Calibration Laboratory’s capability both within the lab and onsite using the Mobile Calibration vehicle
  • Maintain the Mobile Calibration vehicle and associated equipment
  • Well-developed communication skills and ability to liaise with customers
  • Raise Calibration quotes and purchase order requests
  • Completion of all issued audits and required site and safety paperwork
  • Safety, Quality and Compliance focus

What you’ll bring:

  • Previous experience in HV Calibration and Testing Services
  • Knowledge of industry requirements and standards for Testing and Calibration
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritise work to complete within deadlines
  • Collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Strong computer literacy

title: Light Vehicle Motor Mechanic
description_html:
The role of LV Mechanic will see your working at our Forestfield, Forestdale or Balcatta mechanic workshops. You will be responsible for servicing our client's modern flight of vehicles, experience with Ford, Mitsubishi, Hyundai branded vehicles. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some which include:
  • Local Perth workshops
  • Permanent position
  • Long term and consistent works
Key Responsibilities:
  • Workshop works
  • Overhauls
  • Service and repair the mechanical parts including engines, gear boxes & brakes
  • Minor & Major maintenance - Fluid Changes, engine tune ups ect

What you will bring:
  • Australian Recognised Trade Certificate - LV Mechanic 
  • Motor Vehicle repairers Certificate
  • Air Conditioning ticket advantageous
  • Ford, Toyota, Mitsubishi experience preferred
  • EV Hybrid training - advantageous
  • HRWL - Forklift
  • Valid C class Australian Driver’s License
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Willing to be on call if & when required

title: Resource and Mobilisation Officer
description_html:
Monadelphous is looking for a new Mobilisation and Resource Officer to join our team located in the Goldfields! This is a Permanent Full Time opportunity, working Monday to Friday assisting our team with mobilisation tasks such as booking compliance, liaising with operations and ensuring the smooth process mobilisation of our local core crew and contractors. This role will be based in our Kalgoorlie branch, working from 7:30am to 4:00pm. Please be aware that only candidates who live locally to the area will be considered. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Friendly Team Environment
  • Diverse Workload, great for someone beginning their career in Mobilisation 
  • On the Job Training and Support
  • Work for one of Australia's Largest Contractors!
Key Responsibilities:
  • Booking medicals and LabDAS appointments
  • Maintaining compliance of records and site requirements 
  • Keeping up to date with operational changes and roster commitments
  • Liaising with field and Perth based teams
  • Issuing site compliance inductions
What you’ll bring:
  • Great Communication Skills
  • Willingness to Learn and Grow
  • Knowledge of client requirements and compliance
  • Friendly Personality
  • Team Focused Attitude
  • Administration Background 
  • Basic Computer Skills
  • Previous experience in mobilisation is preferred 
Life at Monadelphous

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.



Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.
description_text:
Monadelphous is looking for a new Mobilisation and Resource Officer to join our team located in the Goldfields! This is a Permanent Full Time opportunity, working Monday to Friday assisting our team with mobilisation tasks such as booking compliance, liaising with operations and ensuring the smooth process mobilisation of our local core crew and contractors. This role will be based in our Kalgoorlie branch, working from 7:30am to 4:00pm.
Please be aware that only candidates who live locally to the area will be considered.
Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
Friendly Team Environment
Diverse Workload, great for someone beginning their career in Mobilisation

Work for one of Australia's Largest Contractors!

Booking medicals and LabDAS appointments
Maintaining compliance of records and site requirements
Keeping up to date with operational changes and roster commitments
Liaising with field and Perth based teams
Issuing site compliance inductions
What you’ll bring:
Great Communication Skills
Willingness to Learn and Grow
Knowledge of client requirements and compliance
Friendly Personality
Team Focused Attitude
Administration Background
Basic Computer Skills

Monadelphous are currently seeking experienced and local Mechanical Fitters.  The successful candidates will be responsible for delivering maintenance and project support to our clients in the Gladstone region.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Permanent and Casual, full time positions
  • Opportunity for overtime
  • Home every night while living and working locally

What you will bring:

  • Australian Recognised Trade Certificate
  • Current High Risk Work License (preference for WP, LF)
  • Working at Heights training (within 2 years)
  • Confined Space Entry training (within 2 years)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Local to the Gladstone Region/ Willing to Relocate
Life at Monadelphous 

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply. We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. We have been part of the Gladstone community for over 40 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources, Mineral processing, and Energy sector.

title: Graduate Engineer
description_html:
Join the Monadelphous Graduate Program and embark on a dynamic two-year journey to launch your engineering career. As a Graduate, you'll work on real projects, gaining hands-on experience in a Project Engineer role. You’ll work both on-site and in the office between projects, collaborating closely with your team to gain hands-on experience in project delivery and management.

Regardless of your engineering discipline whether Electrical, Civil, Mechanical, or other you’ll gain valuable exposure to all areas of project engineering. You’ll work on large-scale projects that integrate multiple disciplines, giving you insight into how each one contributes to the overall success. This hands-on experience will help you develop a comprehensive understanding of project engineering within the resources sector.  

Joining our Graduate Program offers you a unique opportunity to fast-track your career with hands-on experience and strong support. As a Graduate, you will have:

  • Opportunity to work on-site, gaining practical experience in project engineering.
  • Ongoing support from a Project Manager, Supervisor, and Graduate buddy.
  • Receive ongoing development through structured Learning & Development modules, workshops, and courses.
  • Benefit from regular catch-ups with the Graduate Team and the chance to network with peers at our annual Graduate Forum.
  • Develop leadership skills and contribute to real-world projects that drive innovation within the industry.
  • The opportunity to participate in a formal Graduate Mentoring Program.
  • Rotations through various business areas, to broaden your skills and explore different career paths regardless of whether your background is in Engineering or Construction Management.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Work with the Project Manager to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet safety and quality standards.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, subcontractors, and internal teams.
  • Manage sub-contractors across various disciplines to ensure alignment with project goals.
  • Assist in preparing project estimates, tender submissions, and developing project schedules.
  • Support all phases of the project lifecycle, including tendering, planning, execution, and HSE compliance.
  • Collaborate with the Operational team to ensure a team-oriented approach to project delivery.
  • Manage project scope, schedule, and budgets as required, ensuring effective execution.

What you’ll bring:


  • Australian or New Zealand Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency or suitable Visa with working rights.
  • A Construction Management or Engineering degree (Bachelor or higher) within the following disciplines: Mechanical, Civil & Structural, Mechatronic, Chemical, Electrical and Electrical & Instrumentation with previous work experience through vacation work or similar, in Australia or New Zealand.
  • Ability to work on a FIFO or DIDO from Perth, Brisbane or Newcastle
  • Previous work experience within your chosen field through internships or equivalent is highly desirable.
  • A passion for the work we do and the desire to do real hands-on work in the field


Life at Monadelphous 


There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.


About us

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

As a Monadelphous Graduate, you will have the opportunity to gain experience across our two key Operational Divisions: Engineering Construction (EC) and Maintenance & Industrial Services (M&IS).

  • In the EC Division, you’ll be involved in large-scale projects spanning civil construction, structural steel fabrication, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.
  • In the M&IS Division, you’ll contribute to a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.


Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.
description_text:
Join the Monadelphous Graduate Program and embark on a dynamic two-year journey to launch your engineering career. As a Graduate, you'll work on real projects, gaining hands-on experience in a Project Engineer role. You’ll work both on-site and in the office between projects, collaborating closely with your team to gain hands-on experience in project delivery and management.
Regardless of your engineering discipline whether Electrical, Civil, Mechanical, or other
you’ll
gain valuable exposure to all areas of project engineering.
You’ll
work on large-scale projects that integrate multiple disciplines, giving
you
insight into how each one contributes to the overall success. This hands-on experience will help you develop a comprehensive understanding of project engineering within the resources sector.
Joining our Graduate Program offers you a unique opportunity to fast-track your career with hands-on experience and strong support. As a Graduate, you will have:
Opportunity to work on-site, gaining practical experience in project engineering.
Ongoing support from a Project Manager, Supervisor, and Graduate buddy.
Receive ongoing development through structured Learning & Development modules, workshops, and courses.
Benefit from regular catch-ups with the Graduate Team and the chance to network with peers at our annual Graduate Forum.
Develop leadership skills and contribute to real-world projects that drive innovation within the industry.
The opportunity to participate in a formal Graduate Mentoring Program.
Rotations through various business areas, to broaden your skills and explore different career paths regardless of whether your background is in Engineering or Construction Management.
Key Responsibilities:
Work with the Project Manager to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet safety and quality standards.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, subcontractors, and internal teams.
Manage sub-contractors across various disciplines to ensure alignment with project goals.
Assist in preparing project estimates, tender submissions, and developing project schedules.
Support all phases of the project lifecycle, including tendering, planning, execution, and HSE compliance.
Collaborate with the Operational team to ensure a team-oriented approach to project delivery.
Manage project scope, schedule, and budgets as required, ensuring effective execution.
What you’ll bring:
Australian or New Zealand Citizenship or Australian Permanent Residency or suitable Visa with working rights.
A Construction Management or Engineering degree (Bachelor or higher) within the following disciplines: Mechanical, Civil & Structural, Mechatronic, Chemical, Electrical and Electrical & Instrumentation with previous work experience through vacation work or similar, in Australia or New Zealand.
Ability to work on a FIFO or DIDO from Perth, Brisbane or Newcastle
Previous work experience within your chosen field through internships or equivalent is highly desirable.
A passion for the work we do and the desire to do real hands-on work in the field
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.
About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.
As a Monadelphous Graduate, you will have the opportunity to gain experience across our two key Operational Divisions: Engineering Construction (EC) and Maintenance & Industrial Services (M&IS).
In the EC Division, you’ll be involved in large-scale projects spanning civil construction, structural steel fabrication, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.
In the M&IS Division, you’ll contribute to a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

The Safe Way is the Only Way.
Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Entry Level Operator
description_html:
We are seeking a Operator with relevant industry experience to join our team at Muja Power Station starting in a casual position progressing to permanent for the right person. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Flexible work / life balance – 2 x 12hr day shifts then 2 x 12hr night shifts with four days off reoccurring. 
  • Core Crew with Long Term works
  • Casual to Permanent Opportunities after probation
  • Opportunity to gain experience and knowledge on the job 

What you will bring:

  • SAP
  • Dozer 
  • Scraper/Water Cart
  • Loader
  • Bobcat
  • Heavy Rigid Truck Licence 
  • Forklift 
  • Valid Australian Driver's License
  • White Card
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Live Local to the South West - within 100km's of Collie (Bus from Collie available daily) 


Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The safe way is the only way.

We embrace the benefits of employing hardworking people from a range of backgrounds, so we encourage applications that contribute to our diverse workplace. If you’d like to see our Diversity Policy, please visit our website.

A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Electricians
description_html:
We are seeking experienced Electricians to support a significant pipeline of work in 2026. With opportunities available across major projects for clients including Rio Tinto, BHP, Woodside and FMG, with varied scopes of work, duration and rosters available. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • 2:1 or 3:1 rosters available
  • Short-term and long-term project opportunities
  • FIFO to West Pilbara region including Karratha, Port Hedland, Dampier
  • Diverse current and upcoming project scopes: Greenfields and brownfield Construction, live LNG plant works, Iron Ore operations, Battery energy storage systems, deconstruction, supply, install and commissioning.
  • Opportunity to join a growing construction division and be part of exciting new projects.
  • Safety and wellbeing are at the forefront of our culture.
  • Work with some of Australia's leading resource and energy clients. 
What you’ll bring:

  • 2 years construction experience
  • Full WA electrical licence
  • Construction White Card
  • LVR/CPR - 1 year validity
  • First Aid - 3 years validity
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Ability to meet additional project-specific requirements
Life at Monadelphous


There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

title: Project Engineer
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently seeking a highly experienced and motivated Project Engineer to join our NSW Operations team on a permanent, full-time basis.

This role is critical in supporting the safe, efficient, and on-budget delivery of multiple shutdowns.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Permanent role with long-term career opportunities
  • Be home every night – live and work locally
  • Supportive team culture with safety and wellbeing at the forefront
  • Exposure to major shutdowns and complex project scopes

Key responsibilities will include:
  • Lead and coordinate site support functions (Quality, Technical, Planning, Commercial)
  • Assist in developing project plans, budgets, and schedules
  • Manage project data, reporting, and commercial documentation
  • Support tender submissions and execution phases
  • Participate in client and contractor meetings, offering practical solutions

What you will bring
  • Site-based experience in the resources sector (highly regarded).
  • Engineering or trade qualifications (preferred).
  • Experience with heavy mechanical or mobile plant equipment (advantageous).
  • Exposure to piping, electrical, or construction projects.
  • Strong leadership, communication, and decision-making skills.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and project management tools.
  • Commitment to safety and compliance.
  • Australia working rights.
  • Open Drivers Licence.


Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

We have been part of the local community in the Hunter Valley and Newcastle region, for over 16 years, proud to be providing jobs in Mining, Mineral processing, and Heavy Industry for this region.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Payroll Administrator
description_html:
Across the Monadelphous workforce, you will find stories of people who took an opportunity to make a difference with us and built a career and lifetime friendships as a result. We employ over 7,500 highly skilled people who contribute positively to our operations and the communities in which we operate. Ours is a culture built over 50 years, and it’s the reason for our continued success.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in the planning, management and execution of maintenance, shutdowns and sustaining capital works. Our delivery of high-quality work within the oil and gas sector had earnt us a solid reputation and enviable relationships with some of the industry’s leading operators.

We have an opportunity available in our Energy division for a Payroll Administrator. This position is a full-time 12 month fixed term role based in our Victoria Park Headquarters.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

We provide the benefits you’d expect from a leading Australian company, but what makes us different?
Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work on some of the world’s biggest resources, energy and infrastructure projects.
Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work on some of the world’s biggest resources, energy and infrastructure projects.
Our loyalty. We want you to reach your potential, we’d like to help you get there.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide high quality administrative support to the team through coordinating payroll, invoicing, timesheets, and monthly claims.
  • Ensure each project is set-up in an efficient manner using forms, registers, reports and databases and where possible implementing new processes to improve efficiencies.
  • Assist in the production of the weekly payroll for various projects by collecting, entering, cost coding and auditing payroll data and preparing it for submission
  • Ensure established procedures are followed accurately and carefully.
  • Respond to requests from customers, suppliers, divisional services and the project team with high value.
  • Coordinating payroll, invoicing, rostering, and training administration
  • Provide Support to the Payroll Administration Lead
  • Provide a high level of support to internal and external customers
  • Generation and updating of reports Dealing with Payroll queries and Leave Requests.
  • Possible Travel to onshore Oil and Gas facility

What you’ll bring

  • Resources experience is desirable but not essential as we encourage applicants from all industries
  • Dynamics 365 experience (desirable)
  • Project administration experience (desirable)
  • Timesheet entry/Payroll experience
  • Excellent administration skills with a high level of organisation
  • The ability to prioritise workload and produce work of a high standard
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Ability to work autonomously as well as within a collaborative team environment
  • Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities

Life at Monadelphous
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specializes in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way.

Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Substation Design Engineer
description_html:
Zenviron have a permanent position available for an experienced Substation Design Engineer to join the engineering team based in the Newcastle Office. 
Reporting to the Electrical Team Leader, you will be responsible for providing quality, safe, and commercially effective engineering designs for large scale Wind Farms and Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) projects. 

If you are skilled in high voltage substation design and want to be a part of key growth across the renewables sector, come and join the inclusive and high performing Zenviron team.
 
Relocation package available. 

Key responsibilities will include: 
  • Performing concept and detailed primary design for large scale HV infrastructure projects, including developing and reviewing single-line diagrams, substation arrangements, cable reticulation design, load flow and fault studies, insulation coordination, transient analysis, earthing and lightning protection design 
  • Preparing and evaluating technical specifications for electrical equipment, including co ordinating with suppliers and subcontractors, ensuring designs and documentation meet the relevant standards AS/IEC 
  • Providing technical leadership and support to the engineering and project teams, including engineering investigations, site inspections, solving problems and making recommendations 

What we are looking for: 
  • Proven experience in 66kV-330kV substation design and/or utility grid connections, including strong working knowledge of Australian Standards (e.g. AS 2067, AS/NZS 3000, AS 1768, ENA Guidelines) and a thorough attention to detail 
  • Proficient in using software modelling tools (e.g. CYMCAP, PowerFactory, PSCAD, CDEGS, PowerCad) 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and good ability to collaborate and develop team capabilities 
  • Australian recognised Bachelor of Engineering (Electrical) or equivalent 
  • Chartered Professional Engineer (CPEng) status with Engineers Australia (or be eligible to obtain on commencement) 
  • Proof of right to work in Australia 

To be successful in this role you will require well-developed interpersonal skills to enable you to build effective stakeholder relationships both internally and externally, whilst you demonstrate a team orientated approach to work and commitment to continuous improvement. Through utilising your time management skills, you will have the ability to achieve tight deadlines whilst delivering high quality and effective designs, and for this we offer an attractive remuneration package. 

We are committed to our philosophy of Empowering People and encourage innovation and creative thinking. We embrace the benefits of employing hardworking people from rich and varied backgrounds, so we encourage applications that contribute to our diverse workplace. 

We understand the importance of recognising each and every member of staff, that’s why at Zenviron your talents will be encouraged to make a valued contribution to the project and the organisation. 

About Us 

Zenviron is a joint venture between Monadelphous and ZEM Energy and is a market leading engineering, procurement and construction services contractor, specialising in the design and construction of large-scale renewable energy projects in Australia.

title: Boilermakers
description_html:
We're recruiting Boilermakers for our Wash Plant and Dragline Maintenance works throughout the Bowen Basin. Varying rosters with 12-hour shifts. You'll join our existing maintenance crew performing shutdown works safely and efficiently.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include: 

  • Continuous work for 2026
  • First project of the year running from January to April 
  • Opportunity for redeployment to other shutdown activity across Monadelphous
  • Casual rates on overtime 

What you will bring

  • Australian Recognised Trade Certificate
  • Ability to pass a 3G/4G Flux Core Weld Test
  • EWP (HRWL) - highly regarded but not essential
  • Working at Heights training
  • Enter and Work in Confined Space training
  • Gas Test Atmosphere training
  • Standard 11 - highly regarded but not essential
  • BMA Core Induction - highly regarded but not essential
  • Coal Board Medical - highly regarded but not essential
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Valid Australian Driver's Licence
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We're committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply. We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application.

About Us 

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we've been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the local Mackay community for over 25 years, proud to be providing jobs for the region in the Resources and Mining sector.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: EEHA Electrical & Instrumentation Inspector
description_html:
Inteforge is a world-class integrated fabrication service provider with proven turnkey capability across heavy industrial sectors. We’re driving a new era of future-industry technologies with a focus on upstream integration with our customers.

With a global presence, Inteforge fabricates structural steel, platework, pipe spooling, pressure equipment and tanks for projects around the world.

Tackling fabrication with a construction mindset is how Inteforge has built a reputation among its peers as leaders of fabrication in the energy, resources and infrastructure sectors. We're known for innovations in manufacturing, delivering and assembling major steel structures. From automation and modularisation to in-house traceability systems, our smart solutions to big challenges continue to improve customer outcomes.

Inteforge services in fabrication includes:

  • Detailing
  • Procurement
  • Fabrication
  • Inspection
  • E&I
  • Modularisation
About the Role: 

Due to uptake in projects we seek expressions of interest from highly motivated EEHA Electrical & Instrumentation Inspector to work with the project management team based in our Tianjin workshop in China, working with the team Supervising and carrying out inspections on vessels and skids  for Gas projects.  The role operates on a FIFO roster (26 - 9 days), serviced apartment (in TEDA) and transportation to and from work is provided.

Our work includes fabrication in large workshops, coordination and delivery of fabrication, welding, projects to a range of blue-chip resources clients across both mining and gas sector.

 To succeed in the role you will possess:

  • Trade Qualification in Electrical, and Instrumentation certification
  • Certificate 3 or 4 Instrumentation
  • Hazardous Areas qualification
  • Australian Electrical Contractor’s Licence (or the ability to obtain)
  • Current CPR / LVR
  • Current passport with minimum 12 months validity
  • Supervisory experience essential, ideally within an overseas/fabrication environment
  • Prior experience in delivering safe and reliable construction service solutions. 
  • Available to start in October 2025 for an 12 month + assignment
This role provides opportunity for a results-oriented Electrical and Instrumentation Inspector - EEHA  seeking and opportunity with a fast-growing organisation working on a range of international fabrication projects.  

Inteforge is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Monadelphous group, a leading Australian (ASX listed) engineering group providing construction, maintenance and industrial services to the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. 

If you’d like to see our Diversity Policy, you can find it on our corporate website.

title: Electrical Project Engineer
description_html:
Monadelphous are seeking a highly motivated Electrical Project Engineer to join our Gladstone Operations team based on Curtis Island QLD.

This role will see you working Monday to Friday (9 day fortnight), on a permanent contract, and will provide engineering services and project management support to the project teams.

Relocation package available.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Be home every night while living and working locally
  • Opportunity for growth and career development
  • Engaging and diverse work across long term contracts
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture

What you will bring

  • Site based experience in the Oil and Gas industry (highly regarded)
  • Previous experience on Brownfield Sites
  • An Australian recognised tertiary qualification in Electrical Engineering
  • Strong, clear written and technical skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strong Team Player
  • Experience in work pack development
  • Confident user of MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
  • Excellent time management skills and demonstrable experience achieving tight deadlines
  • An innovative approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement
  • Proven track record of maintaining a safe working environment

title: EOI - Senior/HSE Advisor
description_html:
Monadelphous Heavy Lift provide a world-class heavy lift service, with an extensive range of the state-of-the-art heavy lift cranes and equipment. Due to exponential growth, we are seeking experienced Senior/HSE Advisors to join the team. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include: 
  • Permanent, on-going FIFO roster 
  • Attractive rates - Competitive pay and benefits 
  • Point of hire, Perth  
  • Good team morale - Join a supportive, collaborative team 
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture 

Key responsibilities include: 
  • Provide HSE advice and support to the site team  
  • Conduct HSE audits, inspections, investigations and training/awareness sessions  
  • Complete Monadelphous and client HSE reporting 
  • Uphold and communicate HSE standards, take action to ensure ‘The Safe Way is The Only Way’ and implementing strategies to improve HSE performance  
  • Assist with the implementation of the HSE Management System and maintaining HSE registers  
  • Co-ordinate site-based risk management processes 
  • Liaise with clients on HSE matters 
  • Communicate and provide support to the project to ensure compliance with relevant HSE laws, regulations, company policies and guidelines 

What you will bring: 
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in a site based HSE role  
  • Diploma qualification in OHS  
  • Certificate IV in Workplace Training and Assessment preferred  
  • Applied First Aid Certificate  
  • Strong understanding and working knowledge of Australian HSE legislation and industry standards  
  • Incident Investigation training  
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills  
  • Confident user of MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint and Excel) 
  • A strong commitment to maintaining a safe working environment 
  • Crane and rigging experience would be highly regarded 

Life at Monadelphous 
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work. 
 
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application 
 
About us 
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice. 
 
Our Engineering Construction division is an increasingly diverse business, focusing on managing and delivering large-scale project management and construction services. Our expertise includes civil construction, structural steel fabrication, modularisation and delivery, as well as structural, mechanical, piping and tank construction. We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure. 
 
Our team of specialists bring a wealth of global experience to every lifting and shift solution, whether it’s a stand-alone lifting job or a fully integrated, multi-disciplinary work package. 
 
Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: (Senior) Project Engineer - Estimating
description_html:
Due to growth and a healthy pipeline of upcoming projects, our construction division is looking for a Senior Project Engineers or Project Engineer to join the estimating team.


We strongly recommend internal applicants (especially FIFO Project Engineers) to apply who are looking to transition into a Perth based role.


This role will be Perth based supporting early construction, constructability, and deliverables. 


Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Perth based in our Victoria Park office, with access to public transport.
  • An opportunity to work with a tier 1 contractor in the resources industry.
  • Internal transfer and secondment opportunities within the business.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with the tender team to ensure project objectives are met on time with respect to cost, safety and quality.
  • Manage the interface between the engineering and project delivery teams to maintain compliance with the specifications, schedules and contract.
  • Manage and supervise the resolution of technical queries as required.
  • Lead the procurement for the project.
  • Compile schedule, cost, progress and forecast reports for the project; ensuring all schedule reporting requirements are met.
  • Provide support to the project team and implement best practice on the project.

What you’ll bring:

  • Extensive experience in Project Engineering on large-scale resources construction projects for similar companies.
  • Tertiary Qualifications in a relevant discipline.
  • A methodical approach, high attention to detail and take responsibility for the quality and accuracy of own work.
  • Be delivery focused, with a high level of self-motivation and drive to support the project in delivering to a tight schedule.
  • Well-developed communication skills and a collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels.
  • Committed to a FIFO roster during the construction phase of the project.

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.


We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.

title: Mechanical Supervisor - Kalgoorlie Local
description_html:
Due to continued growth, Monadelphous is looking for 2x Mechanical Supervisors to join the team at our Goldfields Branch. This is a Casual based role, with ongoing Local & DIDO work opportunities within the Goldfields area. The successful candidates will see themselves leading teams of Mechanical Crews on various project works including structural, piping installation, tank refurbishments and asset integrity. The ideal candidate will need to have had a previous experience of Goldfields sites' conditions. First nations people and female are encouraged to apply. Only local candidates will be considered for this role. 

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Working with one of Australia's Leading Contractors
  • Immediate Start
  • Supportive Team Environment with Continued Growth
  • Flexibility of Local and DIDO work
  • Casual and Ongoing Work Portfolio
Key Responsibilities:
  • Supervising Mechanical Teams of Riggers, Boilermakers, Fitters and Trade Assistants
  • Upholding the Monadelphous Safety Standards
  • Performing Supervisory tasks and activities, including the SWAAP process
  • Interpret project technical information and ensures work is performed in accordance with relevant standards and specifications
  • Lead incident investigations, following established procedures and reporting findings
  • Review and sign off on Risk Assessments and permits for work tasks performed on site
  • Conduct pre-start briefings in alignment with the information provided on the pre-start boards to ensure all team members are informed and prepared
What you’ll bring:
  • 2-5 years experience in a Supervisory role
  • Knowledge of Goldfields clients is desirable
  • Must hold WHS Supervisor Certificate (or have the capacity to obtain one)
  • Proof of Right to Work in Australia
  • Dedication to the safety, well-being and future development of your team

title: Project Control Specialist
description_html:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Project Controls Specialist to support our projects with system setup, training, and general project controls support. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in integrating our new Project Management System InEight, ensuring seamless functionality and support for project personnel. This role requires advanced technical skills, a deep understanding of project controls, and the ability to collaborate effectively with multiple stakeholders. 

The role is full time, permanent opportunity based in our Victoria Park Office, however flexible options would be considered for the right candidate.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Strong remuneration package available
  • Based in VIC Park – Access to multiple Café’s/ food outlets in the vicinity
Key Responsibilities:

System Implementation and Support: 
  • Set up and configure the Project Management System for new and ongoing projects. 
  • Provide comprehensive training and ongoing support to project personnel. 
  • Facilitate integration with relevant software platforms, including P6. 
  • Prepare Control Budget from Tender Budget and coordinate with stakeholders.
Project Engineering Support: 
  • Prepare Quantity Man Hours Reports (QMR). 
  • Oversee P6 integration for scheduling and planning purposes. Conduct re-measurement and quantity claiming tasks to ensure accurate project metrics. 
  • Generate and distribute client and internal reports. 
  • Collaborate on work packaging to streamline project execution

Change and Cost Management: 
  • Manage and document project changes, ensuring proper evaluation and resolution. 
  • Prepare end-of-month project cost reports. 
  • Monitor and manage Actual Costs, Accruals and Commitments Forecast project resource costs and manage budgets effectively

Earned Value Management: 
  • Capture and validate progress in accordance with the progress measurement Analyse Earned Value and compare with budget and cost

End of Month Project Reporting: 
  • Ensure all Project Controls requirements are delivered effectively and on time. 
  • Review project performance using the Performance Metrics and recommend corrective action

Technical Expertise: 
  • Demonstrate advanced proficiency in Excel and P6 software. Leverage experience with ERP systems to enhance project operations. 
  • Identify and propose opportunities for process enhancements

Contract Management: 
  • Work within various contract models, such as Target Cost Estimate (TCE) and Lump Sum (LS), to optimize project outcomes

What you’ll bring:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Project Management, or a related field
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel and Primavera P6 software
  • Experience with ERP systems and their application in project management
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an emphasis on detail
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage with diverse teams.
  • Familiarity with various contract models is highly advantageous
  • Demonstrated experience in budget preparation and cost forecasting
  • Proven track record in delivering training and support for project systems
  • Knowledge of change management processes and earned value methodologies
  • Adaptability to dynamic project environments and ability to meet tight deadlines
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Engineering Construction division is an increasingly diverse business, focusing on managing and delivering large-scale project management and construction services. Our expertise includes civil construction, structural steel fabrication, modularisation and delivery, as well as structural, mechanical, piping and tank construction. We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.
description_text:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated
Project Controls Specialist
to support our projects with system setup, training, and general project controls support. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in integrating our new Project Management System InEight, ensuring seamless functionality and support for project personnel. This role requires advanced technical skills, a deep understanding of project controls, and the ability to collaborate effectively with multiple stakeholders.
The role is full time, permanent opportunity based in our Victoria Park Office, however flexible options would be considered for the right candidate.
Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
Strong remuneration package available
Based in VIC Park – Access to multiple Café’s/ food outlets in the vicinity
Key Responsibilities:
System Implementation and Support
:
Set up and configure the Project Management System for new and ongoing projects.
Provide comprehensive training and ongoing support to project personnel.
Facilitate integration with relevant software platforms, including P6.
Prepare Control Budget from Tender Budget and coordinate with stakeholders.
Project Engineering Support
:
Prepare Quantity Man Hours Reports (QMR).
Oversee P6 integration for scheduling and planning purposes. Conduct re-measurement and quantity claiming tasks to ensure accurate project metrics.
Generate and distribute client and internal reports.
Collaborate on work packaging to streamline project execution
Change and Cost Management
:
Manage and document project changes, ensuring proper evaluation and resolution.
Prepare end-of-month project cost reports.
Monitor and manage Actual Costs, Accruals and Commitments Forecast project resource costs and manage budgets effectively
Earned Value Management
:
Capture and validate progress in accordance with the progress measurement Analyse Earned Value and compare with budget and cost
End of Month Project Reporting:
Ensure all Project Controls requirements are delivered effectively and on time.
Review project performance using the Performance Metrics and recommend corrective action
Technical Expertise:
Demonstrate advanced proficiency in Excel and P6 software. Leverage experience with ERP systems to enhance project operations.
Identify and propose opportunities for process enhancements
Contract Management:
Work within various contract models, such as Target Cost Estimate (TCE) and Lump Sum (LS), to optimize project outcomes
What you’ll bring:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Project Management, or a related field
Advanced proficiency in Excel and Primavera P6 software
Experience with ERP systems and their application in project management
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an emphasis on detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage with diverse teams.
Familiarity with various contract models is highly advantageous
Demonstrated experience in budget preparation and cost forecasting
Proven track record in delivering training and support for project systems
Knowledge of change management processes and earned value methodologies
Adaptability to dynamic project environments and ability to meet tight deadlines
Life at Monadelphous

title: Offshore Rigger/Scaffold Supervisor
description_html:
We are currently seeking experienced Scaffold/Rigger Supervisors to join our Energy Hookup and Commissioning team.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • 3/3 even time roster
  • Day Shifts and Night Shifts available
  • Casual rates + allowances
  • Redeployment opportunities to other world class assets post project
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture

What you’ll bring:

  • Current High Risk Workers Licence
  • MSIC
  • BOSIET/ FOET with CA-EBS
  • Proven offshore oil & gas supervision experience essential
  • Extensive experience in leading scaffold teams
  • Hookup and Commissioning project experience preferred
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

title: Project Engineer SMP
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking a Project Engineer to support our operations in our Maintenance and Industrial Services Division. The role is responsible for providing comprehensive engineering support the projects, including tasks such as leading the team, building client relationships, preparing high quality reporting and defining scope of work.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • FIFO 5:2 4:3 roster from Perth, WA
  • On the job mentoring and coaching
  • Internal transfer and secondment opportunities within the business
  • Yearly salary reviews
Key Responsibilities:
  • Development of RFQ's, review of quotations, manage technical queries
  • Review of internal and subcontractor quality documentation
  • Collation of daily, weekly and monthly reports
  • Interpret drawings, standards, and client procedures
  • Engage and manage sub-contractors
  • Build and foster positive relationships with key stakeholders
What you’ll bring:
  • Experience in a similar role, ideally in a mining environment
  • Previous on-site experience
  • Demonstrated problem solving ability and high attention to detail
  • Strong technical knowledge with an ability to influence scope development and adapt to changing conditions
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills paired with strong interpersonal skills
  • Proof of right to work in Australia
  • Tertiary qualification in engineering (beneficial)

title: HSE Advisor
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking interest from HSE Advisors to work within our Mining and Minerals North West Region. Playing an essential role in the Coastal & West Pilbara team on recently awarded projects.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Casual opportunity on a FIFO 8/6 roster
  • On the job mentoring and coaching
  • Long term portfolio of work
Key Responsibilities:
  • Provide HSE advice and expertise to the site team
  • Conducting and supporting HSE audits, inspections, investigations and training/awareness
  • Monitor work practices to ensure adherence to safety and environmental procedures and standards
  • Ensure all HSE processes and activities; JHA’s, permits etc. comply with relevant HSE legislation and company standards
  • Provide hands on support to implement HSE improvements, plans or solutions
What you’ll bring:
  • Certificate IV qualification in OHS and/ or Environmental or related area is essential, Diploma preferred
  • Minimum 5 years experience in a similar HSE role
  • Previous contractor experience with BHP, FMG or Rio Tinto
  • Well established knowledge of site HSE policies and procedures, and extensive knowledge of HSE legislation and standards and their relevance to Monadelphous
  • Well-developed communication skills and a collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Ability to work autonomously and show initiative with a strong work ethic
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

title: Quality Inspector (NACE)
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking experienced NACE Inspectors to join our Mining Team, supporting our Maintenance and Industrial Services Division.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • FIFO role on offer on a 2:2 roster
  • On the job mentoring and coaching
  • Internal transfer and secondment opportunities within the business
Key Responsibilities:
  • Compile and coordinate QA/QC documentation deliverables for each individual project (QMP, ITP's, FIC's etc)
  • Complete site monitoring activities
  • Coordinate the capture of site QC documentation and MDR compilation for each project
  • Deal directly with client QA/QC representatives
  • Acting as an interface with internal stakeholders
What you’ll bring:
  • Ideally NACE 2 or equivalent qualification
  • Experience in a similar role within construction and/or resource industry experience is advantageous
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills paired with strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work autonomously and show initiative with a strong work ethic
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

title: Project Accountant
description_html:
Due to continued growth we are currently seeking a highly motivated Project Accountant to join our team based in our head office in Victoria Park. You will be responsible for providing financial management support and assistance for the execution of project work.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Permanent fulltime position available for an immediate start
  • Victoria Park location, with public transport and free parking close by
  • Large scale Oil & Gas contract
Key Responsibilities:
  • Have a genuine interest, desire and ability to learn that can be demonstrated from past experience
  • Manipulate large data sets into usable information
  • Work independently and demonstrate the ability to verify your own work
  • Understand the relationships between systems, the data they house and the function they perform
  • Have a high level of excel proficiency, the ability to translate solutions into formulas and explain those solutions to those less familiar with excel
  • Have the ability and confidence to build good working relationships and rapport with a wide range of colleagues. E.g. Site based personnel, client representatives, back-office staff and immediate team members
What you’ll bring:
  • A tertiary qualification in Accounting or Finance (essential)
  • Certified Practising Accountant (CPA) or Chartered Accountant (CA) (desirable or working towards)
  • 3+ years’ experience in a similar role within the resource industry

title: Fabric Maintenance Coordinator
description_html:
Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in the planning, management and execution of maintenance, shutdowns and sustaining capital works. Our delivery of high-quality work within the oil and gas sector has earnt us a solid reputation and enviable relationships with some of the industry’s leading operators.

We’re recruiting for a Fabric Maintenance Coordinator to join our Energy team in Perth. This role will be responsible for supporting the execution of maintenance work safely and efficiently ensuring the right quality and within budget.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Our work. We offer diverse, challenging work on some of the world’s biggest resources, energy and infrastructure projects.
  • Our culture. We’re solution focused, reliable and embrace a ‘can-do’ team environment.
  • Our loyalty. We want you to reach your potential, we’d like to help you get there.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for delivery of FM Fabrication maintenance services in line with client processes and schedule/cost objectives whilst maintaining compliance with client Planned Entry Criteria, Contract HSSE, Quality and Employee Relations Management Plan
  • Developing FM Fabrication Campaign work packs, resourcing materials/equipment, planning, scheduling & coordinating the campaign for execution.
  • Focal point for WRAPS scope coordination and execution, interface with engineering for WRAPS management and tracking.
  • Assist in the preparation of Permits, Risk Assessments and HAZOPS/HAZIDS as required.
  • Liaise with Engineering, Vendors and Suppliers as required for progression of work scopes.
  • Attend offshore sites for pre-scoping, walk down of scope and Kick-off/start of major campaigns as required.
  • Attend After-Action Reviews (AAR) and produce lessons learned.
  • Facilitate vendor kick-off & readiness meetings for larger scopes.
  • Raise MOC/TSR as required to update systems, processes, Bill of materials and SAP master data.
  • Demonstrate commitment to and drive a culture of strict compliance with the Monadelphous principle of The Safe Way is the Only Way.
  • Participate and engage in safety interactions with crew and field leadership.
  • Work closely with onsite Supervisors to Maintain Campaign compliance to plan.
  • Drive continuous improvement and lessons learned.

What you’ll bring:

  • Relevant coatings or insulation trade or Engineering Qualification. Strong experience in coating, insulation and fireproofing application, supervision and/or inspection.
  • Extensive working knowledge and experience with SAP PM (required).
  • Oil & Gas experience, preferably offshore (desirable).
  • Experience throughout work life cycle, building work packs, planning/scheduling and site execution.
  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate across all levels.
  • Proof of right to work in Australia.

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Electrical Supervisor
description_html:
High Energy Service (HES), a Monadelphous Business, is currently seeking an experienced and motivated Electrical Supervisor to join our Resources Team. Due to the nature of the role, the point of hire is required to be based in Perth and surrounding areas. This role is classified as a FIFO position with occasional Metro or Workshop posts as required.

Working with HES offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Competitive remuneration packages that reward experience and competency
  • HES has a long-term sustainable business model that enables us to offer a full-time position with excellent, long-term job security
  • Extensive internal development and training opportunities allowing you to continually progress your career and capabilities
  • The working roster is flexible, enabling you to take control of your workload

Key Responsibilities:

  • Supervising Technicians, Engineers and Apprentices performing maintenance works on mine sites in the Pilbara
  • A strong commitment to maintaining a safe working environment
  • Extensive involvement with work planning and scheduling
  • Ability to mentor Apprentices
  • Ensuring all Safety and Quality documentation is completed
  • Experience in customer communications

What you’ll bring:

  • Proven leadership and people management skills
  • Well-developed communication skills and a collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Prior shutdowns experience advantageous
  • Strong computer Literacy
  • Trade Qualified Electrician / WA Electrical Licence
  • HV experience preferred
  • Schedule 26 preferred
  • Unrestricted WA Drivers Licence
  • Right to work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

High Energy Services (HES) is a Monadelphous Business and one of Australia's leading high voltage service providers. Operating from a purpose-built facility in Wangara, we specialise in testing, maintenance, compliance, commissioning, installation and engineering for high voltage assets across mining, utilities and energy.  With a team of more than 100 highly skilled professionals, HES is committed to developing its people and provides opportunities to grow your career while working with industry-leading technology and projects.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.
