title: Paint & Blast Supervisor
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking a Paint & Blast Supervisor to support our Coastal & West Pilbara Operations Core Crew. This is an exciting opportunity to join our Marine Structural Integrity project on Rio Tinto's CLA Wharf as a crucial member of the team. This project is dedicated to the remediation of corrosion to the wharf through blast & paining and welding disciplines. The successful candidate will oversee and supervise paint and blast works on the wharf, ensuring tasks are carried out effectively, within budget, and to highest standards of quality and safety. This is a casual position on a 2:1 roster, FIFO from Perth to Karratha. We encourage First nations people and female applicants to apply.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Immediate start with longevity of project work
  • FIFO from Perth, to Karratha WA
  • On the job support and mentoring from an established team
  • Guaranteed opportunities for professional development and career advancement within Monadelphous
  • Access to extensive employee benefits and discounts

Key Responsibilities:

  • Supervision of the Paint & Blast crew working on the wharf
  • Working collaboratively between various disciplines to complete remediation works successfully
  • Acting as a first point of contact for crew seeking leadership and support
  • Liaising effectively between the crew and our client
  • Upholding our core value 'The Safe Way is the Only Way'

What you’ll bring:

  • 2-5 years of supervision experience in mining and minerals in this discipline
  • Australian Qualified Trade Certificate
  • NACE preferred
  • Previous experience in Marine Projects is desirable
  • Familiar knowledge with Rio Tinto processes and procedures
  • Dedication to the successful delivery of work
  • Proof of Right to Work in Australia

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the local community for over 35 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in civil, structural, mechanical and electrical capital projects, maintenance and industrial services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: HSE Officer
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking a HSE Officer to join our Mining & Minerals North West (MMNW) team. The successful applicant will enter our HSE Pathway Program, gaining the opportunity to learn from and work alongside our highly experienced Senior HSE leadership team through structured mentoring and coaching. This entry-level role provides a strong pathway into a mature, industry-leading business with a deep commitment to safety and wellbeing. As part of the program, you will be enrolled in our HSE Passport, a structured development framework that combines self-directed learning with field-based verification of practical HSE skills. These skills will be developed through supported site allocations across our projects and operations within the Pilbara region. This role is Perth-based, with site travel becoming more frequent as you progress and build confidence within the HSE Pathway Program.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Enrolment in a formal HSE development program to kick start a career in HSE
  • On the job mentoring and coaching
  • Perth based role with site travel offering exposure across the division
  • Long term opportunity in a dynamic team environment
  • The chance to build capability and experience within an industry-leading, multi-disciplinary organisation

Key Responsibilities:

  • Utilise knowledge and experience to resolve HSE issues and to identify improvement / corrective actions
  • Maintain the MMNW HSE lessons learnt library
  • Support the HSE Manager with the day-to-day operation of our HSE management system
  • Actively participate in field-based placements and provide ad hoc HSE coverage toward the end of the program, once ready for supported allocations
  • Organise information into HSE forms, registers, reports or databases for dissemination to others. Maintains and stores HSE related information and responds to requests for currently available information
  • Work cooperatively with internal stakeholders to achieve common business goals

What you’ll bring:

  • A positive, team focused attitude with a strong willingness to learn and grow within the HSE discipline
  • Willingness and ability to undertake site travel and rostered roles
  • Strong written and interpersonal skills
  • Advanced Diploma or Diploma in Work Health & Safety or similar is advantageous
  • Experience in a similar relevant allied field, such as exercise physiology, physiotherapy providing a solid foundation of related skills and knowledge

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the North West communities for over 30 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in heavy lift, maintenance and industrial services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: HSE Coordinator
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking an experienced HSE Coordinator to join our Mining & Minerals Northwest (MMNW) team. This role will support the HSE Manager with day-to-day management of the Monadelphous HSE Management System, delivery of strategic HSE actions, and ad hoc field support across our operations as required.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Perth based role with ad hoc site travel
  • On the job mentoring and coaching
  • Long term, permanent opportunity
  • Internal transfer and secondment opportunities within the business
  • The chance to build capability and experience within an industry-leading, multi-disciplinary organisation
Key Responsibilities:
  • Provide hands on support to implement HSE improvements, plans or solutions.
  • Supporting the delivery of the MMNW HSE Strategic Plan
  • Supporting our tender teams with HSE pre-deliverables for projects, as well as subcontractor risk assessments
  • Provide HSE advice and expertise to the site team
  • Conducting and supporting HSE audits, inspections, investigations and training/awareness
  • Monitor work practices to ensure adherence to safety and environmental procedures and standards
What you’ll bring:
  • Certificate IV qualification in OHS and/ or Environmental or related area is essential, Diploma preferred
  • Experience in a similar HSE role along with leadership/ mentoring experience
  • Ability to undertake site travel for ad hoc operational support including leave cover and peak support
  • Well established knowledge of site HSE policies and procedures, and extensive knowledge of HSE legislation and standards and their relevance to Monadelphous
  • Well-developed communication skills and a collaborative, team-oriented approach with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

title: HSE Administrator
description_html:
Monadelphous is seeking a HSE Administrator to join our clients offshore turnaround, commencing in mid-2026.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • 3:1 roster
  • Casual hourly rate + 40% Offshore allowance on all hours worked
  • Short term project (execution will run for approximately 65 days)
  • Be part of a world class FLNG facility

Key Responsibilities:

  • Providing health, safety and environmental support to our Energy division
  • Developing campaign material to promote HSE awareness
  • Ongoing HSE systems review, development and implementation including the identification and integration of lessons learned and best practice.
  • HSE Systems reporting, analysis, audits, investigations and projects
  • Preparation and facilitation of Toolbox material, HSE presentations and workshops
  • Assist HSE Incident investigations (TapRoot qualifications desirable)
  • Implementing HSE improvement projects in collaboration with our operating Divisions
  • Monitoring and communicating changes in health, safety and environmental legislation

What you’ll bring:

  • Degree in HSE or a related field + Diploma or certificate qualifications in Training & Assessment, or a related field is highly desirable
  • Experience in a similar role within construction and/or resource industry experience is advantageous
  • Flexibility for short-term site travel from time to time
  • Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work autonomously and show initiative with a strong work ethic

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Engineering Construction division is an increasingly diverse business, focusing on managing and delivering large-scale project management and construction services. Our expertise includes civil construction, structural steel fabrication, modularisation and delivery, as well as structural, mechanical, piping and tank construction. We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.

We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Business Systems Developer
description_html:
Across the Monadelphous workforce, you will find stories of people who took an opportunity to make a difference with us and built a career and lifetime friendships as a result. Ours is a culture built over nearly 50 years, and it’s the reason for our continued success.

Due to continuous growth, we have a new opportunity for a highly driven Business Systems Developer to join our Business Improvement Team in our Perth Office. This role is responsible for developing and implementing process improvement solutions across our Mining & Minerals division. If you have extensive experience in Engineering, Computer Science, IT, Business or equivalent, and pride yourself on building strong stakeholder relationships, we would love to hear from you.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Working alongside a collaborative and established team with extensive knowledge
  • Continued personal and professional development pathways
  • Opportunities to be a part of upcoming major business development projects
  • Outstanding leadership support and company benefits
  • Avenues to demonstrate your dynamic thinking and ideas

Key Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain applications, workflows, and system integrations to support business operations
  • Analyse existing systems and workflows to identify performance gaps, inefficiencies, and automation opportunities
  • Design and implement scalable, maintainable solutions using modern development tools and frameworks
  • Test, deploy, and support systems in production, including resolving day-to-day technical issues
  • Collaborate with users and technical teams to refine requirements and improve system usability
  • Evaluate new technologies and recommend improvements aligned with business needs
  • Work directly with clients at times to clarify requirements, validate assumptions, and ensure delivered solutions meet real-world needs

What you’ll bring:

  • Minimum 2+ years’ experience in a similar or equivalent role with proven experience delivering business process improvements with measurable benefits
  • Development experience in PL/SQL and low-code platforms (e.g. Power Apps, OutSystems) and programming experience in C#, JavaScript, Python and Excel VBA
  • Power BI and Paginated Report development and management experience, including strong use of DAX for calculations, modelling and debugging
  • Proven ETL experience using Power Query (M), integrating data from a range of sources such as SQL, Excel, SharePoint, APIs, Dataverse and flat files
  • Experience designing and maintaining data models using enterprise data from multiple applications to support accurate reporting and analytics
  • Experience working with Microsoft Dataverse, including Dataverse tables, relationships and views. Creating / modifying tables using power apps or dynamics 365 and integrating Dataverse with power automate or power BI preferred, but not mandatory
  • Exposure to Dynamics 365, including understanding Dataverse data, basic customisation and support of business processes. Azure familiarity (data, integration, or app services) preferred, but not mandatory
  • Experience or awareness of Power Platform environment management, including user access, solution deployment, performance and governance preferred, but not mandatory
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an innovative mindset and ability to adapt to change
  • Highly motivated and eager to learn, with strong communication, interpersonal, coaching and stakeholder engagement skill
  • Tertiary qualifications in Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, Business Management or Project Management preferred, but not mandatory
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the North West communities for over 30 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in heavy lift, maintenance and industrial services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way

title: Administration Officer
description_html:
Monadelphous is looking for enthusiastic and hardworking Administration Officer to join our RTW Fabrication Team in Capel. You will be responsible for providing administration support to our workshop, assisting with multiple long term projects within the South West region. We are seeking an individual who can work flexibly as part of a team or autonomously on their own. This role comes with many opportunities to develop your career, with multiple pathways available in Monadelphous! This is a Capel based role, and only local applicants will be considered.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • Plenty of upcoming work and projects, were only getting bigger!
  • On the job coaching and mentoring
  • Internal transfer and secondment opportunities within the business
  • Career Development provided if required in training depending on the individual
Key Responsibilities:
  • General Receptionist duties 
  • Administration of documentation and record keeping tasks
  • Managing our multiple asset registers and onboarding documentation 
  • Assisting our operations team with broad tasks 
  • Directing queries and assisting customers and clients where required 
What you'll bring: 
• Minimum 1 years’ experience in a similar position within the industry, desirable
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office products
• Strong attention to detail and maintain efficiency in your work
• Have good work ethic and strong ability to build rapport
• Be flexible in your approach to the changing working environment, with the ability to be adaptable
• Good time management, multitasking and prioritisation skills
• Ability to build and maintain relationships
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• A team orientated approach and a confident and energetic manner

Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been part of the local community (Goldfields, Roxby Downs and South West WA) for over 30 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in maintenance and shutdown services and repairs and fabrication.

title: Electrical Activity Planner
description_html:
We’re recruiting for a full-time Electrical Activity Planner to join our Onshore Energy team in Darwin. This role will ensure quality delivery of electrical works to ensure compliance with Company Maintenance Plans and Performance Standards, in conjunction with applicable codes, Australian standards, and specifications. They will oversee work scope estimation, resourcing, development of work packs, material procurement and temporary equipment management in support of various electrical works across site.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Salary sacrifice and novated leasing available
  • Discounted health insurance
  • Local Darwin role
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture

Key Responsibilities:

  • Reviewing, planning and scheduling all recurring PM (preventive maintenance) activities
  • Development of corrective work orders from notification
  • Development of an integrated maintenance work schedule for the maintenance area supervisor/leads (including PM, PDM, and non-emergency repair work orders).
  • Reviewing and identifying changes needed to PM program (based on activity results) and/or changes to equipment design and/or inventory management practices to optimize the overall maintenance process
  • Assist asset planners/Schedulers to deliver executable work for onshore facilities
  • Resource estimation, work pack build, activity planning and basic scheduling of operation outages and package maintenance
  • Collaboration with facility short, mid and long term planning teams for accurate work scope scheduling
  • Build and maintain strong vendor relationships, understanding all supply forecasts and ensure that vendors adhere to any and all processes and standards
  • Review and provide feedback/actions from all vendor and third party compliance reports
  • SAP training and answering client queries

What you’ll bring:

  • Technical trade or Electrical Engineering Diploma
  • High Voltage planning/maintenance experience preferred
  • EEHA planning/maintenance experience preferred
  • Experienced in using SAP
  • Similar experience as a maintenance scheduler/planner in the resources industry
  • Maintenance scheduling using SAP
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

title: HSR Mechanical Coordinator
description_html:
We’re recruiting a High-Speed Rotating (HSR) Mechanical Coordinator to join our Onshore and Offshore Energy teams in Perth. This role will be responsible for executing maintenance work safely and efficiently in time with the right quality at optimal cost. This is a great opportunity to get your foot in the door if you are looking at getting into the Oil & Gas industry.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Salary sacrifice and novated leasing available
  • Discounted health insurance

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for delivery of HSR Mechanical maintenance services in line with business processes and schedule/cost objectives whilst maintaining compliance with the Contract HSSE, Quality and Employee Relations Management Plans.
  • Building Campaign work packs and ensure materials meet schedule execution time frame and reschedule where required.
  • Work with schedulers to assist with schedule loading and advise criticality of work scope prior to revision lock.
  • Arrange vendor mobilisation and ensure relevant competencies are up to date.
  • Maintain equipment BOM via cataloguing and MOC process.
  • Identify packages of work and liaise with other discipline planners/coordinators to maximise maintenance efficiency and minimise equipment down time.
  • Ensure maintenance plans and MWI’s are fit for purpose. Liaise with relevant discipline engineers and implement changes via MOC process.
  • Assist in the preparation of Permits, Rick Assessments and HAZOPS/HAZIDS as required.
  • Liaise with Engineering, Vendors and Suppliers as required for progression of work scopes.
  • Attend site for pre-scoping, walk down of scope and Kick-off/start of major campaigns as required.
  • Complete After-Action Reviews (AAR) on campaign and produce lessons learned. Raise MOC/TSR as required to update systems, processes and SAP data.
  • Demonstrates commitment to and drive a culture of strict compliance with the Life Saving Rules and adherence to the Monadelphous principle of The Safe Way is the Only Way.
  • Practically implement the continuous improvement and lessons learned programs on a Contract-wide basis.
  • Monitors compliance with all statutory and regulatory requirements and ensures that such requirements are known to all supervisors and staff and always complied with

What you’ll bring:

  • Mechanical Trade or Engineering Qualification.
  • Extensive working knowledge and experience with SAP PM (required).
  • Experience with High-Speed Rotating equipment (Compressors, Generators, Turbines, Gearboxes etc) (required)
  • Oil & Gas experience, preferably offshore.
  • Experience throughout work life cycle, building work packs, planning/scheduling and site execution.
  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate across all levels.

This is a great opportunity to get your foot in the door if you are looking at getting into the Oil & Gas industry.
Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
Flexible      working arrangements
Salary      sacrifice and novated leasing available
Discounted      health insurance
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible      for delivery of HSR Mechanical maintenance services in line with business      processes and schedule/cost objectives whilst maintaining compliance with      the Contract HSSE, Quality and Employee Relations Management Plans.
Building      Campaign work packs and ensure materials meet schedule execution time      frame and reschedule where required.
Work      with schedulers to assist with schedule loading and advise criticality of      work scope prior to revision lock.
Arrange      vendor mobilisation and ensure relevant competencies are up to date.
Maintain      equipment BOM via cataloguing and MOC process.
Identify      packages of work and liaise with other discipline planners/coordinators to      maximise maintenance efficiency and minimise equipment down time.
Ensure      maintenance plans and MWI’s are fit for purpose. Liaise with relevant      discipline engineers and implement changes via MOC process.
Assist      in the preparation of Permits, Rick Assessments and HAZOPS/HAZIDS as      required.
Liaise      with Engineering, Vendors and Suppliers as required for progression of      work scopes.
Attend      site for pre-scoping, walk down of scope and Kick-off/start of major      campaigns as required.
Complete      After-Action Reviews (AAR) on campaign and produce lessons learned. Raise      MOC/TSR as required to update systems, processes and SAP data.
Demonstrates      commitment to and drive a culture of strict compliance with the Life      Saving Rules and adherence to the Monadelphous principle of The Safe Way      is the Only Way.
Practically      implement the continuous improvement and lessons learned programs on a      Contract-wide basis.
Monitors      compliance with all statutory and regulatory requirements and ensures that      such requirements are known to all supervisors and staff and always      complied with
What you’ll bring:
Mechanical      Trade or Engineering Qualification.
Extensive      working knowledge and experience with SAP PM (required).
Experience      with High-Speed Rotating equipment (Compressors, Generators, Turbines,      Gearboxes etc) (required)
Oil      & Gas experience, preferably offshore.
Experience      throughout work life cycle, building work packs, planning/scheduling and      site execution.
Exceptional      communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to      communicate across all levels.
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.
We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application
About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.
Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.
We work with some of the most successful energy companies on some of the largest and most significant projects and facilities in Australia and overseas. We deliver a diverse range of services to onshore and offshore operations.
Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise:
The Safe Way is the Only Way
. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: Project Planner
description_html:
Monadelphous is currently on the lookout for a planner for one of our major construction projects in WA on a 2:1 basis.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:
  • FIFO 2:1
  • Site allowances and attractive penalty rates
  • Opportunity to join our growing construction division and be part of an exciting new project.
  • Safety and wellbeing at the forefront of our culture
Key Responsibilities:
  • Working closely with various teams to develop seamless interfaces between the functions to enable the safe, consistent and reliable planning of all shutdown activities
  • Estimate and breakdown the scope to match it to the schedule for reporting purposes
  • Update activities and statuses based on information from all sources in P6
  • Managing and making necessary adjustments to planning priorities as required
  • Scoping the full extent of shutdown work needed to conduct the relevant activities in the project during shutdown periods
  • Maintain and continuously improve job plans and task lists
  • Ensure key performance indicators are captured and reported
  • Manage reporting of daily shutdown progress
What you’ll bring:
  • 3-5 years+ experience in a similar onsite role within the resources environment
  • Experience forecasting labour demand
  • Proven high level of computer literacy, specifically in MS Excel and Primavera P6
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to foster interpersonal relationships across all levels
  • A methodical approach, paying attention to detail and taking responsibility for the quality and accuracy of own work and meeting deadlines
  • Well-developed analytical capabilities
  • You are positive, reliable and motivated with a desire to make a difference
  • Ability to undertake a site roster
Life at Monadelphous
There’s lots to get involved in, celebratory or cultural events and so much more. We work hard to make Monadelphous a truly great place to work.

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally, encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply and strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application

About us
Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Engineering Construction division is an increasingly diverse business, focusing on managing and delivering large-scale project management and construction services. Our expertise includes civil construction, structural steel fabrication, modularisation and delivery, as well as structural, mechanical, piping and tank construction. We also specialise in heavy lift and haulage services, electrical and instrumentation work and renewable energy infrastructure.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

title: EOI - E&I Technicians
description_html:
Expression of interest for experienced E&I Technicians to join our team in the highlands of Papua New Guinea. Contract would commence in February, running for 3 months working on a 4:4 roster. The successful candidates will have strong experience in Hazardous Areas.

Working with Monadelphous offers many benefits, some of which include:

  • Gain international experience in Papua New Guinea
  • Competitive payrate

What you will bring

  • Current electrical license
  • Current Passport
  • CPR/LVR within 12 months
  • Cert III Instrumentation
  • Cert IV in Hazardous Area – Electrical (EEHA)
  • HV Switching Certificate (Desired)
  • Experience in Hazardous Areas
  • Working at Heights training (within 2 years)
  • Confined Space Entry training (within 2 years)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Valid Australian Driver’s License
  • Proof of right to work in Australia

We celebrate our diversity and shared values and are committed to inclusion and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to hiring locally and encourage people of all diverse backgrounds to apply.  We strongly encourage women and First Nations people to submit an application. 

About us

Monadelphous is an ASX-200 company providing multidisciplinary construction, maintenance and industrial services to many of the largest companies in the resources, energy and infrastructure sectors. Established in 1972, we’ve been working in Australia and around the world for more than 50 years. We work on the biggest projects and ensure our teams have a variety of opportunities available to follow their career path of choice.

Our Maintenance and Industrial Services division specialises in providing comprehensive, multidisciplinary maintenance and improvement solutions for customers across Australia and internationally, through a network of supporting workshops and operations in key regional areas, within the resources, energy and industrial sectors. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of services including the planning, management and execution of mechanical and electrical maintenance and project services, shutdowns, civil and infrastructure works, fixed plant maintenance services, access solutions, specialist coatings and rail maintenance services.

We have been operating in Papua New Guinea over 18 years, proud to be providing jobs for the local region in structural, mechanical, piping, electrical, civil, and other large-scale services.

Safety is at the forefront of everything we do, and we live by our promise: The Safe Way is the Only Way. Apply now to get started. A career at Monadelphous is a career with a difference. Make it yours.

Recruitment Contacts

Brisbane Recruitment: 07 3505 1504
